ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 3-1. - Amendments to codes generally. 
    Revisions of and amendments to the codes referred to in this chapter shall be adopted as provided in § 21-19-25, Miss. Code Ann. 1972. 
(Code 1963, § 8-6) 
Sec. 3-2. - Housing code-Adopted. 
(a)  The Standard Housing Code, 1994 Edition, published by the Southern Building Code Congress International, Inc., is hereby adopted by reference as though copied herein fully, including all referenced standards and appendices. 
(b)  Throughout the housing code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the City of Gulfport who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in such code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Code 1963, § 141/2-1; Ord. No. 1834, § 1, 5-2-89; Ord. No. 1922, §§ 1-3, 3-2-93; Ord. No. 1974, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94) 
Sec. 3-3. - Same-Appeals. 
    In addition to the appeals provided by section 107 of the housing code, an appeal from decisions of the building official and/or housing board of adjustments and appeals to the mayor and city council is hereby provided, and all provisions that the decisions of the building official and/or the housing board of adjustments and appeals shall be final are modified to the extent of permitting appeal to the mayor and city council. In considering such appeals the mayor and city council shall have each and every power and authority granted by the city's housing code to the building official and/or the housing board of adjustments and appeals. 
(Code 1963, § 141/2-2) 
Sec. 3-4. - Annual license renewals. 
    Any plumbing, gas, mechanical (air conditioning and heating), or electrical contractor who holds an appropriate valid license from the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, or other governmental entity within the State of Mississippi, and who has otherwise met applicable requirements of the city for such construction activity, shall be entitled to have such license renewed annually upon making written application to the city for such renewal and paying an annual renewal fee of fifty dollars ($50.00). 
(Ord. No. 1898, § 1, 10-29-91) 
Editor's note- Section 1 of Ord. No. 1898, adopted Oct. 29, 1991, amended the Code by adding a new § 3-250. For purposes of classification, such section was codified as § 3-4 at the discretion of the editor. 
Cross reference- Licenses and business regulations, Ch. 5. 
Sec. 3-5. - Unsafe building abatement code adopted. 
(a)  The Standard Unsafe Building Abatement Code, 1985 Edition, is hereby adopted by reference as though copied herein fully, including all referenced standards and appendices. 
(b)  Throughout the unsafe building abatement code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the city who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in said code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Ord. No. 1978, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 1978, adopted Oct. 18, 1994, did not specify manner of codification; hence, inclusion of §§ 1 and 3 of the ordinance as § 3-5 was at the discretion of the editor. It should also be noted that § 2 of the ordinance provided that in the event of conflict between existing city ordinances and the unsafe building abatement code adopted by this section, the most restrictive code, standard or regulation shall prevail. 
Sec. 3-6. - One- and two-family dwelling [and multiple single family dwellings] code adopted. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the International Residential Code, 2018 edition, including Appendices A, B, C, D, E, G, H, I, J, M, N, O, P and Q, and omitting Section R313 and P2904 and Chapter 11 in their entirety (see International Residential Code Section 102.5, 2018 edition), as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Residential Code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing the construction, alteration, movement, enlargement, replacement, repair, equipment, location, removal and demolition of detached one- and two-family dwellings and multiple single family dwellings (townhouses) not more than three (3) stories in height with separate means of egress in the City of Gulfport; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Residential Code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section 3-10 of this article. 
(b)  This code shall be the governing and prevailing code for one- and two-family dwelling construction, notwithstanding any local amendments. 
(c)  Throughout the dwelling code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the city who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in said code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Ord. No. 1976, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94; Ord. No. 2051, §§ 1-3, 6-4-96; Ord. No. 2495, § 1, 10-3-06; Ord. No. 2651, §§ 1, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2809, § 1, 10-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2957, § 1, 8-7-18) )

Sec. 3-8. - Work commencing before permit issuance. 
    Any person who commences any work on a building, structure, electrical, gas, mechanical or plumbing system including any fire protection, fire alarm or suppression system before obtaining the necessary permits shall be subject to a penalty of one hundred (100) percent of the usual permit fee in addition to the required permit fees. 
(Ord. No. 2331, § 3, 9-12-02) 
Sec. 3-9. - Renewal of contractor's licenses. 
    All renewal of any contractor's licenses (certificate of competency) shall be renewed at the first of October. A license not renewed prior to October 1 of any year may be renewed thereafter upon payment of the aforesaid license and taxes and payment of an additional fifty (50) percent of the renewal license fee. 
(Ord. No. 2331, § 14, 9-12-02)

Sec. 3-30. - Fire zones established.

(1)  First fire zone. The boundaries of the district known and designated as the first fire zone shall be, and is described, as follows: Beginning at the intersection of the centerline of the alley running north and south between 21st and 22nd Avenues in the City of Gulfport, with the north line of U.S. Highway 90, and running thence north along the centerline of said alley to the south line of the Louisville & Nashville Railroad right-of-way; thence running in a southwesterly direction along the south line of said railroad right-of-way to a point due south, or in the centerline of the alley running north and south between 24th and 25th Avenues in the City of Gulfport; thence running north along the centerline of said alley between 24th and 25th Avenues to the centerline of 25th Street in the City of Gulfport; thence running west along the centerline of 25th Street to the centerline of the alley running north and south between 25th and 26th Avenues in the City of Gulfport; thence running due south along the centerline of said alley to the south line of Louisville & Nashville Railroad right-of-way; thence running in a southwesterly direction, along the south line of said railroad right-of-way, to the center of the alley between 30th and 31st Avenues in the City of Gulfport; thence running south to the north line of U.S. Highway 90; thence running in a northeasterly direction along the north line of U.S. Highway 90, to the point of beginning.

(Code 1963, § 8-7)

Sec. 3-31. - Schedule of permit fees. 
(a)  On all buildings, structures or alterations requiring a building permit, as set forth in section 103 of the building code, a fee shall be paid as required at the time of filing application, in accordance with the following schedule: 
Base fee. A base fee of thirty dollars ($30.00) for each permit plus permit fees listed below. 
$0.00-$500,000.00. Twenty-four dollars ($24.00) for the first one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) plus four dollars ($4.00) for each additional thousand or fraction thereof up to and including five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00). 
$500,001.00 and up. Two thousand twenty dollars ($2,020.00) for the first five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00) plus three dollars twenty cents ($3.20) for each additional thousand or fraction thereof. 
(b)  For the moving of any building or structure, the fee shall be fifty dollars ($50.00). 
(c)  For the demolition of any building or structure, the fee shall be twenty-five dollars ($25.00). 
(d)  Where work for which a permit is required by this code is started or proceeded with prior to obtaining such permit, the fees herein specified shall be doubled, but the payment of such double fee shall not relieve any persons from fully complying with the requirements of this code in the execution of the work nor from any other penalties prescribed herein. 
(e)  One-half (1/2) of the building permit fee shall be paid to the building official at the time of submitting plans and specifications for checking, and the remaining one-half (1/2) of the building permit fee shall be paid to the building official at the time the building permit is issued. 
(f)  The above charges to be in addition to fees which may be charged in connection with electrical or plumbing work or inspection thereof. 
(g)  The above schedule of permit fees shall not duplicate the permits provided for under the comprehensive zoning ordinance of the city, and only one (1) permit shall be required under both the zoning ordinances and the building code of the city. 
(Code 1963, § 8-5; Ord. No. 2332, § 1, 9-12-02; Ord. No. 2486, §§ 2, 3, 8-22-06; Ord. No. 2667, § 2, 3-17-10) 
Sec. 3-32. - Moving of buildings or structures, restoration or refinishing of same. 
(a)  Application for permit. The owner and/or any person moving any building or structure to, from, or upon any lot or parcel of land within, outside, or into the city from outside the city limits, shall be required to file an application for the movement of same and with such application shall file detailed specifications setting forth the intention of such applicant with regard to restoring or refinishing of any such building or structure upon its new location within the city. The completion of such moving shall be accomplished within fifteen (15) days from the date of issuance of permit, or within such time as may be specified in the permit, and the restoring or refinishing of such building or structure shall be completed within the period of ninety (90) days from the date of issuance of such permit. The permit for the removal and relocation of such building shall be issued by the building official of the city, and the renovation shall be done in accordance with the zoning code, building code, plumbing code and electrical code of the city. Further, all required permits must be obtained by a licensed contractor. Provided, however, when a building or structure is to be moved outside the city limits, it shall not be necessary to file specifications as to restoring or refinishing the same. 
(b)  Bond required. The owner and/or any person moving any building or structure within the city shall be required to post a bond with the director of finance and administration in the amount of six thousand dollars ($6,000.00), underwritten by a corporate surety bonding company duly licensed to do business in the state, or in lieu of such corporate surety bond, deposit a cash bond in such amount. The purpose of this bond shall be to insure compliance with the requirements of this section and to cover the cost of cleaning such property of all debris occasioned in moving and in completing the restoring or refinishing of the building or structure as required in subsection (a) of this section. Provided, however, when a building or structure is to be moved outside the city limits, the bond as herein provided shall be two thousand dollars ($2,000.00). Upon compliance with the provisions of this section, and the inspection and approval by the city's building official, the bond so posted shall be returned to the person posting same. 
(c)  Failure of owner to restore or refinish building; demolition. In the event the owner and/or the person posting the bond as herein provided, fails to comply with the provisions of this section, upon recommendation of the city building official and the approval by the mayor and city council, the city may apply the bond proceeds toward removal of debris and restoration or refinishing of the building or structure. Provided, however, if the city building official determines that there are not sufficient funds from the bond so posted to complete restoration or refinishing of the building or structure then, in that event, upon his recommendation and the approval by the mayor and city council, and upon thirty (30) days' notice to the person posting the herein required bond, the city may cause the building or structure to be demolished with all costs taken from the bond proceeds. All additional costs over and above available funds from the bond shall be assessed against the property in the form and manner by law required and, any excess funds shall be refunded to the person posting the bond. 
(d)  Notices. All notices required by this section shall be by certified mail. 
(Code 1963, § 23-4.1) 
Cross reference- Motor vehicles and traffic, Ch. 6. 
Sec. 3-33. - Existing buildings code adopted. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the International Existing Building Code, 2018 edition, with Appendices B and C (See International Existing Building Code, Section 101.6, 2018 edition), as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Existing Building Code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing the repair, alteration, change of occupancy, addition, and relocation of existing buildings, including historic buildings in the City of Gulfport; and provide for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Existing Building Code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section 3-35 of this article. 
(b)  Throughout the existing building code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the City of Gulfport who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in such code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
Ord. No. 1840, § 1, 5-30-86; Ord. No. 1925, §§ 1-3, 3-2-93; Ord. No. 2621, § 3, 2-17-09; Ord. No. 2657, §§ 1, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2811, § 1, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2958, § 1, 5-7-18 ) 
Cross reference- Amendments, revisions, § 3-35 
Sec. 3-34. - Standard for residential construction in high wind regions. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the ICC 600 (Standard for Residential Construction in High Wind Regions), 2014 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the high wind residential construction code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing the design and construction of residential buildings in high-wind regions and to specify prescriptive methods to provide wind-resistant designs and construction details for residential buildings constructed in high-wind regions; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said ICC 600 Code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section (b) of this section. 
(b)  That Ordinance No. 2818 of the City of Gulfport by which the City of Gulfport adopted the ICC 600 (Standard for Residential Construction in High-Wind Regions), 2008 edition, and all other ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed. 
(Ord. No. 1977, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94; Ord. No. 2818, §§ 1, 2, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2968, § 1, 8-7-18 )

It should also be noted that § 2 of the ordinance provided that in the event of conflict between existing city ordinances and the hurricane residential construction manual adopted by this section, the most restrictive code, standard or regulation shall prevail.

Sec. 3-36. - Appeals/Meetings/Terms. 
(a)  Appeals from the construction board of appeals . Any person or any officer, department or agency of the city aggrieved by any decision of the construction board of appeals may within fifteen (15) days thereafter appeal therefrom to the city council by filing with the building official a written notice of appeal specifying the decision from which the appeal is taken. In case of such appeal, the construction board of appeals shall cause a transcript of the proceedings to the case to be certified to the city council, and the matter will be heard on said transcript and record, with such hearing to occur within sixty (60) days of receipt of the record and transcript(s) by the City Clerk. The city clerk shall coordinate the scheduling of this appeal with the city council through its clerk. Within seven (7) days after filing the notice of appeal, the city clerk shall estimate the cost of preparation of the record on appeal, including but not limited to the cost of the preparation of the transcript, and the appellant shall deposit that sum with the city clerk. The failure of the appellant to prepay the estimated cost of preparation for the record on appeal, including, but not limited to, the cost of preparation of the transcript, may result in dismissal of the appeal for failure to comply with this regulation. When the city clerk determines that dismissal may be warranted for failure to comply with this regulation, the city clerk shall give written notice to the party in default, apprising the party of the nature of the deficiency. if the party in default fails to correct the deficiency within seven (7) days after notification, the appeal shall be dismissed by the city clerk. The attorney or representative for the party in default has the burden to correct promptly any deficiency or to see that the default is corrected by the appropriate official. 
(b)  Appeals from the city council. Appeals from any action of the city council shall be governed by any applicable statutes, regulations, or rules of the State of Mississippi or its courts. 
(c)  Meetings. The construction board of appeals shall adopt policies and procedures which are necessary to carry out its duties and, therein, shall establish a meeting schedule which it shall follow. 
(d)  Third alternate. In addition to the two alternates required by appendix B (B101.2.1) of the 2006 International Building Code, a third alternate, who meets the same qualifications as the two (2) required alternates, shall be appointed by the mayor and ratified by the city council. 
(Ord. No. 2777 , § 2, 5-8-13) 
Secs. 3-37-3-40. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - GENERAL CONTRACTORS[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 1891, §§ 1-8, adopted May 7, 1991, did not specifically amend the Code; hence, codification of said sections as Div. 2, §§ 3-41-3-48 was at the discretion of the editor. 
Cross reference- Electrical contractors, § 3-201 et seq.; licenses and business regulations, Ch. 5. 

Sec. 3-41. - Definitions. 
    As used in this division [the following terms] are defined and classified as follows: 
    Certificate of responsibility: A certificate number held by a contractor issued by the Mississippi State Board of Contractors. 
    Class A: General contractors whose services are unlimited with respect to the type of structure on which such contractors may work are defined as class A general contractors and shall be required to have at least ten (10) years' work experience as an architect, engineer, contractor or superintendent of construction or a combination of these qualifications or other equivalent work experience and qualifications and shall be required to furnish to the city acceptable work references verifying such experience. 
    Class B: General contractors whose services are limited to commercial structures and multiple-dwelling residential structures are defined below as class B contractors as well as other services described by the definition for a "class C" general contractor set forth herein below. Any person contracting or undertaking as prime contractor, subcontractor or subcontractor of any tier to do any erection, building, construction, reconstruction, repair, maintenance or related work on any public or private project. 
(1)  Any contract or undertaking by a prime contractor, subcontractor or subcontractor of any tier involving erection, building, construction, reconstruction, repair, maintenance or related work where such contract, subcontract or undertaking is less than fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00); 
(2)  Any contract or undertaking on a private project by a prime contractor, subcontractor, or subcontractor of any tier involving erection, building, construction, reconstruction, repair, maintenance or related work where such contract, subcontract or undertaking is less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00); 
(3)  A residential project to be occupied by fifty (50) or fewer families and not more than three (3) stories in height; 
(4)  A new construction project not exceeding seven thousand five hundred (7,500) square feet and not more than two (2) stories in height. 
    Class C: General contractors whose services are restricted to one- and two-family dwellings and accessory use structures in connection therewith and/or the alteration and repair of nonresidential buildings, where structural strength, stability or required fire protection are not involved, are defined and classified as class C general contractors. If a property owner desires to construct his own dwelling, such property owner will be deemed a class C general contractor for purposes of this division. 
    Person: Any person, firm, corporation, partnership, association or other type of business entity. 
    Private project. A project or erection, building, construction, reconstruction, repair, maintenance or related work which is not funded in whole or in part with public funds. 
    Public agency: Any board, commission, council or agency of the State of Mississippi or any district, county or municipality thereof, including school, hospital, airport, and all other types of governing agencies created or operated under the laws of this state. 
    Public funds. Monies of public agencies, whether obtained from taxation, donation or otherwise; or monies being expended by public agencies for the purpose of which such public agencies exist. 
    Public project: Any project for erection, building, construction, reconstruction, repair, maintenance or related work which is funded in whole or in part with public funds. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 1, 5-7-91; Ord. No. 2024, § 1, 8-22-95) 
Sec. 3-42. - Certification and licensing. 
(a)  All general contractors operating within the city shall be required to be certified or licensed by the city building code board of adjustments and appeals, and no building permits shall be issued to any such general contractor who does not have such certification or license. To obtain a certificate, an applicant shall submit an application in writing to the board, or other official designated by the board, containing the statement that the applicant desires the issuance of a certificate and the class of certificate desired on a form containing the information prescribed by the board and such application shall be accompanied by an application fee as set forth elsewhere in this division. Such license or certificate of competency shall be issued by the building code board of adjustments and appeals to all general contractors who become qualified by examination by the city building code board of adjustments and appeals. Any holder of a valid certificate of competency issued heretofore by the building code board of adjustments and appeals of the city who does not renew said certificate within sixty (60) days after the end of the city's fiscal year during or for which such certificate was issued, shall be subject to a fifty (50) percent renewal penalty. A limited certificate of competency applicable for a single job may be issued by such board and shall automatically expire upon completion of the project for which such limited certificate of competency was issued. No such limited certificate of competency shall be issued unto the same party for new structures within the five-year period following the issuance of such initial certificate of competency. In such event, the building official shall fully document his reasons for issuing such temporary permits and his action in so doing shall be subject to review and possible revocation by the city building code board of adjustments and appeals. 
(b)  A certificate of competency based upon the examination of an individual representing a partnership, firm or corporation shall be valid only during the time that such individual is a member or supervising employee of such partnership, firm or corporation. The building official may issue temporary licenses for periods not to exceed sixty (60) days in cases where he determines such action necessary to avoid undue hardships. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 2, 5-7-91) 
Sec. 3-43. - Examinations. 
(1)  Application for certificate of competency. Those persons, firms or corporations who are not holders of a certificate issued by the city building code board of adjustment and appeals shall apply for such certificate of competency. Such application shall be accompanied by evidence of good moral character and integrity, a statement of familiarity and knowledge of the appropriate building codes of the city and knowledge of the zoning laws of the city, and such other matters as the board may deem to be necessary and applicable. 
(2)  Public liability insurance. The applicant shall furnish evidence that the applicant has in force a policy of public liability insurance for the protection of the public covering the applicant's proposed work in a sum of not less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00)/three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00), together with completed product coverage. 
(3)  Written examination. The city participates in a cooperative testing program in the state for standardized testing by the Southern Building Code Congress International, Inc. (SBCCI). Before an applicant is granted a certificate of competency the city building official must receive and report to the building code of adjustment and appeals a report from the SBCCI that the applicant has received a passing score on the Mississippi Standard Contractor Examination. A passing score shall satisfy the written examination requirements for licensing. 
(4)  Examination fees. Applicant shall pay all examination fees as required by SBCCI to sit for the standard examination. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 3, 5-7-91; Ord. No. 2085, § 1, 6-3-97) 
Sec. 3-44. - Application fees. 
    The application required for a contractor license (certificate of competency) shall be accompanied by a fee described below: 
General. 
Class A-Gpt ..... $200 
Class B ..... 150 
Class C 100 MS-General ..... NC *

The contractor license (certificate of competency) may be renewed from year to year upon payment of the license fees listed above, without reexamination, provided that proof of insurance is provided. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 4, 5-7-91; Ord. No. 2085, § 1, 6-3-97; Ord. No. 2331, § 8, 9-12-02) 
Sec. 3-45. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2331, § 2, adopted Sept. 12, 2002, deleted § 3-45, which pertained to plans and specifications review fees and derived from Ord. No. 1891, § 5, adopted May 7, 1991. 
Sec. 3-46. - Penalty. 
(a)  Any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this division or who fails to comply therewith or who shall commence construction without such license or certificate of competency and the appropriate building permit shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or by imprisonment for not more than sixty (60) days or both such fine and imprisonment. In the event of any such violation, any certificate, license or permit issued to such contractor shall be subject to revocation. Such revocation or suspension of license and certificate of competency shall be by action of the building code board of adjustments and appeals and shall be subject to appeal as other similar actions are appealed to the mayor and city council, and thereafter to the appropriate state courts as in the case of appeals of administrative decisions of other municipal boards and commissions. Prior to the revocation or suspension of any such license or certificate of competency or building permit, any contractor and/or subcontractor affected thereby (electrical, plumbing, or heating and air conditioning, etc.) shall first be given reasonable opportunity, not less than thirty (30) days, to appear before the building code board of adjustments and appeals, (electrical, plumbing, heating and air conditioning, etc.) to show just cause why such revocation or suspension should not be imposed. 
(b)  The imposition of one (1) penalty for any violation shall not excuse the violation and shall not be justification for such violation to continue; and all such persons shall be required to correct or remedy such violations or defects within a reasonable time; and when not otherwise specified, each ten (10) days during which such prohibited conditions continue shall constitute a separate offense. Further, the application of the above penalty/penalties shall not be held to prevent the enforced removal of prohibited conditions by other appropriate legal remedies. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 6, 5-7-91) 
Sec. 3-47. - Grandfather provisions. 
    All general contractors currently licensed by the city, and in good standing on May 7, 1991, shall be exempt from the aforesaid written examination process. Good standing is defined as holding a valid contracting license and having provided proper bonds and insurance and licenses to the city which were valid and in effect on May 7, 1991. Proper documentation shall be provided by the applicant attesting to the status of the privilege tax license, required surety bond or public liability insurance, and the contractor license as May 7, 1991. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 7, 5-7-91; Ord. No. 1947, § 1, 10-4-93) 
Sec. 3-48. - Reciprocity. 
    General contractors applying for certificate of competency shall be exempt from the written examination requirement if they satisfy either of the following conditions: (1) Furnish proof of passing the applicable Mississippi Standard Contractors Examination administered for a participating jurisdiction by SBCCI; or (2) furnish a certified copy of a State of Mississippi Certificate of Responsibility. A general contractor who has such a license shall not be required to hold such a license for a minimum of one (1) year. 
(Ord. No. 1891, § 8, 5-7-91; Ord. No. 1949, § 1, 10-5-93; Ord. No. 2085, § 1, 6-3-97) 
Secs. 3-49-3-55. - Reserved.

Cross reference- Amendments, revisions, § 3-87. 
Sec. 3-57. - Definitions and construction of terms. 
    The following definitions and rules of construction shall be used in interpreting this article. Terms not defined in this section shall have the meanings prescribed in the Standard Plumbing Code: 
    Auxiliary vent is an additional vent stack assisting the main vent which passes through the roof independently. 
    Back vent is that part of a vent line which connects directly with an individual trap near the fixture and extends either to the main or branch vent pipe. 
    Caliber, size; length. The given caliber or size of a pipe is for its standard internal diameter and the length of a pipe is its developed length taken along the centerline. 
    Distance. The distance of pipes from each other or from fixtures is the horizontal distance between centers of pipes or fixture outlets. 
    Fixture or fixtures, when used in general sense, applies to all receptacles which receive the house sewage or waste from which water is used as a flush; when used specifically, it means any of such receptacles, including water closets. It also means any tank or other contrivance or heater or vessel through which water passes to supply hot water to a bathtub, sink, basin or other vessel where hot water is needed. 
    Flow line is the extreme top or overflow point of a fixture. 
    Inspector, when used without prefix or affix, means the chief inspector charged with the enforcement of the provisions of this plumbing article and the rules contained herein. 
    Main drain means a lateral or main drain of the horizontal piping of a house drainage system, extending from the house drain to its connecting with a main or private sewer and conveying the drainage of one (1) or more buildings on the same lot. 
    Outside water closet is any closet that is installed in a building detached from the main building and not inhabited, or on the porch of a house when it is located in a room which has no door or other opening between it and the main house. 
    Seal of the trap is the height of the water column measured between the point of overflow and the dip of diversion level separating the inlet and outlet arms of the trap. 
    Sewer is a general term for a system of horizontal drainage from any building site to main public or private sewer. 
    Soil or waste vent is that part of the main soil or waste pipe above the highest installed branch or fixture outlet connection extending through the roof. 
(Code 1963, §§ 20-1, 20-3) 
Sec. 3-58. - Persons authorized to do work. 
    All plumbing work shall be performed under the supervision of a qualified licensed master plumber, occasionally referred to in this article as master contractors, and shall be performed by master plumbers or journeymen plumbers; provided that licensed gasfitters, licensed under this article, may replace (but not initially install) floor furnaces, wall heaters, space heaters or other gas appliances, except those connected to water or electrical services, subject to permit and inspection as provided herein. Any person may do the plumbing in the residence owned and occupied by him as a home provided it meets the requirements of this article. 
(Code 1963, § 20-1) 
Cross reference- Licenses and business regulations, Ch. 5. 
Sec. 3-59. - Nonconforming fixtures. 
    No fixtures shall be installed and no fixture shall be reconnected or reinstated where it does not meet with the requirements of this article. 
(Code 1963, § 20-2) 
Sec. 3-60. - Plumbers to report unsanitary conditions. 
    It shall be the duty of every plumber doing work in the city to report to the county health department all unsanitary conditions coming to their attention. The failure of any plumber to report such conditions within twenty-four (24) hours after they come to his attention shall be a misdemeanor. 
(Code 1963, § 20-4) 
Cross reference- Health and sanitation, Ch. 4. 
State Law reference- Municipal regulation of health, Miss. Code Ann. 1972, § 41-3-57. 
Sec. 3-61. - Regulations applicable to new systems in old buildings. 
    New systems of plumbing in old buildings are governed by the same rules and regulations as those which govern new systems of plumbing in new buildings. 
(Code 1963, § 20-5) 
Sec. 3-62. - Permits, requirements for work in old buildings. 
    Applications must be made and permits obtained for all extensions, alterations or other work to be done in connection with the house drain, any plumbing work or water supply in old buildings, except minor repairs, and the work shall be done in the same manner and under the same rules as work in new buildings. By minor repairs are meant leaks in pipes, traps and cocks or faucets; opening up waste pipes, traps and drains through cleanouts only and repairing broken fixtures and broken pipes. All repairs on sewer side of traps must be inspected. 
(Code 1963, § 20-6) 
Sec. 3-63. - Plumbing board created; membership, terms, vacancies. 
    The mayor, with the confirmation of the city council, shall appoint five (5) practical and experienced plumbers, one (1) of whom shall be a journeyman plumber, to serve for three-year staggered terms on what shall be known as "the plumbing board," unless sooner removed by the mayor with the confirmation of the council. All vacancies in the board because of resignation, death or removal prior to the expiration of the term of any member shall be filled by appointment made for the unexpired term of such member who has vacated his office. One (1) member of the plumbing board shall be named as chairman on a majority vote of the board, and the members of the board, together with the city engineer, shall constitute and act as a board of examiners. Members of the plumbing board shall receive the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00) per year in partial reimbursement of expense in connection with performance of their duties. 
(Code 1963, § 20-8; Ord. No. 1790, § 1, 12-22-87) 
Cross reference- General government, Ch. 1. 
Sec. 3-64. - Advisory duties of board; duty to require examination and to certify plumbers. 
    The duties of the board will be to act as an advisory board in matters pertaining to plumbing and drainage of buildings. It shall be their duty to require all plumbers who wish to engage in the business to pass the Mississippi Standard Contractors Examination in the appropriate category as the only written examination required, and to require the applicant to prove competency by such interviews, references, and practical requirements as the board shall require for all applicants as a prerequisite to issuance of a certificate of competency and authority to engage in the business of plumbing as a master plumber. 
(Code 1963, § 20-9; Ord. No. 2085, § 2, 6-3-97) 
Sec. 3-65. - Master contractors to be certified, licensed, post bond. 
    Anyone applying to engage in the plumbing business as a master contractor, before being certified, must take the appropriate Mississippi Standard Contractors Examination administered by the Standard Building Code Congress International, Inc. (SBCCI), of which Gulfport is a participating jurisdiction, and the board must receive a report from SBCCI that said applicant has received a passing grade on the standard written examination in the required category. The applicant must then secure a privilege license from the city clerk and make bond of three thousand dollars ($3,000.00), indemnifying the city against loss or damage caused by the failure of such contractor or employee to comply with the City Code of Ordinances and regulations or caused by any negligence of the contractor. 
(Code 1963, § 20-10; Ord. No. 2085, § 2, 6-3-97) 
Sec. 3-66. - Examination fee for master plumber; issuance, renewal of certificates. 
    Applicant shall pay for all examination fees as required by SBCCI to sit for the standard examination. The contractor's license fee (certificate of competency) shall be issued if the applicant passes the standard written examination and satisfies the practical requirements of the plumbing and mechanical board. The license fee shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00). Such licenses must be renewed annually at the first of October. Each licensed master plumber shall be entitled to renewal of the license at the first of October upon payment of all state, county or city license fees or taxes. A license not renewed prior to October 1 of any year may be renewed thereafter upon payment of the aforesaid license and taxes and payment of an additional fifty (50) percent of the renewal license fee. 
(Code 1963, § 20-11; Ord. No. 2085, § 2, 6-3-97; Ord. No. 2331, § 9, 9-12-02) 
Sec. 3-67. - Master to make deposit for street repair; revocation of licenses. 
    In addition to the three thousand dollar ($3,000.00) bond above enumerated, the applicant for certification as a master contractor shall deposit with the city clerk fifty dollars ($50.00), which sum, or so much thereof as may be necessary, may be used under the direction of the street commissioner or the plumbing inspector in repairing any street or other public property where the applicant failed to properly repair the same. Such deposit and the bond provided for in section 3-65 shall be at all times maintained by the applicant. Each plumber's license shall be renewed annually. Plumbers' licenses may be revoked for violation of the plumbing ordinances of the city. 
(Code 1963, § 20-12) 
Sec. 3-68. - Examination and certification of journeymen plumber and pipe fitters. 
    Anyone applying to engage in the plumbing business as a journeyman plumber or pipe fitter in the city, before being certified, must take the appropriate Mississippi Standard Contractors Examination administered by SBCCI, of which Gulfport is a participating jurisdiction, and the board must receive a report from SBCCI that said applicant has received a passing grade on the standard written examination in the required category. Applicant shall pay all examination fees as required by SBCCI to sit for the standard examination. The certificate shall be issued if the applicant passes the standard written exam and satisfies the practical requirements of the board. Certificates issued during any year shall expire at the end of the calendar year. Renewal of certificates shall be done without reexamination upon application accompanied by a renewal process fee of ten dollars ($10.00). 
(Code 1963, § 20-13; Ord. No. 2085, § 2, 6-3-97) 
Sec. 3-69. - Suspension, revocation of licenses for violations. 
    Any licensed plumber who shall neglect or refuse to comply with these regulations or with the conditions of the permit shall have his license suspended or revoked, shall thereby be debarred from obtaining permits or doing plumbing work by such length of time as the plumbing board shall deem just and proper, and shall also be liable to prosecution. 
(Code 1963, § 20-14) 
Sec. 3-70. - Suspension of licenses for bad faith, delay; responsibility for violations by employees. 
    Bad faith or unreasonable delay in plumbing work shall be deemed a sufficient reason for subjecting the plumber so offending to a suspension of his license, and every plumber shall be held responsible for the violation of these regulations by mechanics, laborers and helpers employed by him, as well as mechanics, laborers and helpers themselves. 
(Code 1963, § 20-15) 
Sec. 3-71. - Workers to be competent. 
    All plumbing and drainage work shall be done by competent workers for each particular class of work. 
(Code 1963, § 20-16) 
Sec. 3-72. - Inspector may stop incompetent workers. 
    At the discretion of the plumbing inspector, he may stop any journeyman from performing such work as he deems the worker or mechanic is not competent or sufficiently skillful to perform. 
(Code 1963, § 20-17) 
Sec. 3-73. - Qualifications met before beginning work; possession of permit; allowing fraudulent use of name. 
    Before beginning any work all of the requirements mentioned for qualifications must be complied with and permit issued for such work must be in possession of that person making application for such permit. No person conducting a plumbing business shall allow his name to be used by any person. 
(Code 1963, § 20-18) 
Sec. 3-74. - Inspector's right of entry; enforcement powers and duties. 
    The plumbing inspector is hereby given police power with authority to enter any and all buildings and places within the city limits for the purpose of inspecting plumbing, drainage and ventilation already constructed or in the course of construction, repair or alteration, and in all cases where the plumbing inspector finds that this article or any other plumbing ordinance of the city has been or is being violated, he shall have the authority, and it shall be his duty, to arrest or cause to be arrested the person so violating the law and shall file the necessary charges against such person, who shall be dealt with subject to punishment as herein provided. 
(Code 1963, § 20-23) 
Sec. 3-75. - Submission, approval of plans. 
(a)  Required for new buildings. The plumbing, drainage, and plumbing ventilation in all buildings, both public and private, erected in the city shall be executed in accordance with plans previously approved by the plumbing inspector, in writing, and suitable drawings and descriptions of the plumbing and drainage and means of ventilation shall be in each case submitted and placed on file in the office of the plumbing inspector. 
(b)  Plans for identical systems. Where the buildings are situated together on one (1) street and the plumbing is the same in each, the plan for one (1) building in the block will be sufficient. 
(c)  Standards for plans. Plans of the plumbing and drainage of buildings must be drawn on heavy paper or tracing cloth seven (7) by eleven (11) inches or multiples thereof. One (1) vertical drawing is sufficient for a building when it can be made to show for all work, if not, others must be submitted. 
(d)  Beginning time required. Plans of the plumbing work filed with this department for approval shall state within what time the work therein will begin. If it is not begun under the approved plans within the time therein specified such plans must be again presented to the department for consideration. 
(e)  Details required. Every plan must be accompanied by a clear description thereof, or abstract of the specification, on a blank prescribed and supplied for this purpose by the department showing block and lot numbers of each house, size, kind, and weight of pipes and kind of traps, closets, and fixtures to be used. 
(f)  Expiration of approval. Plans are approved upon the condition that such approval expires by its own limitation within six (6) months from the date of permit, unless work under it is then in progress. 
(g)  Deadline for approval, rejection. Plans and specifications will be approved or rejected within five (5) days from the date of filing with the inspector. 
(h)  Changes, modifications. No change or modification of plans will be permitted unless such change or modification is submitted to the department, approved and placed on file, as in the case of the original work, and no alteration of the original plan will be allowed, except on the written application of the owner of the property or his duly authorized agent. 
(Code 1963, § 20-24) 
Sec. 3-76. - Applications for inspections. 
(a)  Applications for inspections must be filed at the office of the inspector of plumbing by the plumber, on blanks, furnished by the city. 
(b)  Applications for roughing-in inspections must be made when roughing-in is complete and this includes water supply, unless same is exposed on walls or ceilings, and before any of the work is covered up or made inaccessible to the inspector. 
(c)  For sewer inspections applications must be made, stating time when sewer will be complete and before same is covered. 
(d)  For final inspections application must be made when all fixtures are complete and before the house drain is connected or any portion of the system is used. 
(Code 1963, § 20-29) 
Sec. 3-77. - Certificate of inspection. 
    When any plumbing work for which a permit has been issued is completed and done in accordance with the rules and regulations of this article, it shall be the duty of the plumbing inspector to issue a certificate of inspection to the plumber certifying that the plumbing work has been inspected and approved by him; and water will not be turned on to the premises or meter placed until the plumbing inspector's certificate is in the hands of the water department. 
(Code 1963, § 20-31) 
Sec. 3-78. - Testing required. 
    All plumbing work must be tested by the plumber in the presence of the inspector before it is accepted. When it is inconvenient or impracticable to test the entire work at one time, it can be tested in sections. 
(Code 1963, § 20-32) 
Sec. 3-79. - Procedure for roughing-in tests. 
    All roughing-in tests must be made with water. For such testing the iron extension of the soil pipe outside of the house or building shall be securely closed, as shall all branches, inlets and other openings of the work to be tested. The closing of joints and pipes must be sufficiently tight and strong to withstand the pressure of a column of water reaching to the top of the pipe to be tested, with a minimum ten-foot head required. The pipe shall then be filled with water to its top and shall stand so without perceptible lowering. If the water is lowered by leakage, the leakage must be found and made tight by the plumber, and the work shall not be approved by the inspector until the water stands at the top without perceptible lowering. 
(Code 1963, § 20-33) 
Sec. 3-80. - Testing extensions, alteration of existing system. 
    In case of extension or alteration of any existing plumbing system, the same, if new stacks are run, shall be tested when roughed-in and when completed as hereinbefore provided. 
(Code 1963, § 20-34) 
Sec. 3-81. - Fixtures to be open; concealing work before inspection. 
    All plumbing fixtures shall be installed as open plumbing and no plumbing or drain laying work shall be covered up until inspected by the inspector or his deputy who shall show his badge of authority on request. 
(Code 1963, § 20-35) 
Sec. 3-82. - Inspections, plans when special permits issued. 
    Where special permits are issued, the location shall be inspected before the work is started and duplicate plans shall be submitted, approved and placed on file. These plans shall show the proposed work in plan and elevation. 
(Code 1963, § 20-36) 
Sec. 3-83. - Permit and inspection fees. 
    The installation, enlargement, alteration, repair, removal, conversion or replacement any plumbing system, the installation of which is regulated by the adopted plumbing code, by a licensed plumbing contractor shall first make application to the code official and obtain the required permit before the work is started in accordance with the schedule listed below. 
Plumbing permit fee schedule. Permit fees shall be include a base permit fee for issuing each permit plus a fee for each fixture listed below.

Sec. 3-84. - Excavation permit required; charge for repairs. 
    It is hereby required that a permit be taken out for each excavation in any street, avenue, alley or sidewalk. Whenever any person making an excavation on the street or alley fails to refill the same in a proper manner as required by this article, or fails to maintain the same for a reasonable period satisfactorily to the city engineer, then the director of public works shall cause such work to be done, and the cost thereof shall be charged against the deposit hereinafter provided. It is further provided that the city shall set up a fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) for three-quarter-inch pipe and twenty dollars ($20.00) for one-inch pipe which shall be the normal charge for each repair to streets, avenues, alleys or sidewalks to any person applying therefor, all work and liability involved to rest solely with the city. 
(Code 1963, § 20-43) 
Sec. 3-85. - Swimming pools. 
    All plumbing work and related fixtures, fittings or facilities in swimming pools shall be installed by journeymen plumbers under the supervision of a licensed master plumber. No swimming pool may be filled by hose except under the supervision of a licensed master plumber. 
(Code 1963, § 20-51) 
Cross reference- Parks, grounds and beautification, Ch. 8. 
Sec. 3-86. - Swimming pool [and spa] code adopted; temporary fence required. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the International Swimming Pool and Spa Code, 2018 edition, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Swimming Pool and Spa Code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing the construction, alteration, movement, enlargement, replacement, repair, equipment, location, removal and demolition of swimming pools, spas, hot tubs, aquatic facilities and related equipment; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Swimming Pool and Spa Code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section 3-87 of this article. 
(b)  Further, all licensed pool contractors shall erect a temporary fence (at least forty-eight (48) inches high) at the beginning of excavation and during construction of the pool; said fence shall be removed only after final inspection by the building official. 
(c)  Throughout the swimming pool code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designed [designated] official of the city who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in such code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Ord. No. 1808, § 2, 7-5-88; Ord. No. 1924, §§ 1-3, 3-2-93; Ord. No. 1975, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94; Ord. No. 2815, § 1, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2964, § 1, 8-7-18 ) 
Editor's note- Sections 1 and 2 of nonamendatory Ord. No. 1808, have been codified herein as § 3-86 at the editor's discretion. 
Cross reference- Rules and regulations for parks and recreational areas, § 8-71 et seq.; water and sewers, Ch. 11.

DIVISION 2. - GAS 

Sec. 3-101. - Purpose; gas code adopted; compliance required. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the International Fuel Gas Code, 2018 edition, including all Appendices (See International Fuel Gas Code, Section 101.3, 2018 edition), as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Fuel Gas Code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing fuel gas systems and gas-fired appliances in the City of Gulfport; and providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Fuel Gas Code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section 3-108 of this article. 
(b)  Throughout the gas code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the city who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in such code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Code 1963, § 20-63; Ord. No. 1838, § 1, 5-2-89; Ord. No. 1921, §§ 1-3, 3-2-93; Ord. No. 1972, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94; Ord. No. 2113, § 1, 11-5-97; Ord. No. 2498, § 1, 10-4-06; Ord. No. 2654, §§ 1, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2808, § 1, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2959, § 1, 8-7-18 ) 
Cross reference- Amendments, revisions, § 3-108. 
Sec. 3-102. - Definitions. 
    The following definitions are provided for the purpose of interpretation and administration of this division: 
    Certain appliances means conversion burners, floor furnaces, central heating plants, vented recessed heaters, water heaters and boilers. 
    Certificate of approval means a document or tag issued and/or attached by the inspector to the inspected material, piping, or appliance installation, filled, out, together with date, address of the premises, and signed by the inspector. 
    Gas company means any persons distributing natural gas within the corporate limits of the city, or authorizing and proposing so to engage. 
    Inspector means the person appointed as inspector and shall include each assistant inspector (if any), from time to time, acting as such under this division by appointment of the mayor and city council. 
(Code 1963, § 20-62) 
Sec. 3-103. - Provisions not to impose liability. 
    This division shall not be construed as imposing upon the city any liability or responsibility for damages to any person injured by any defect in any gas piping or appliance mentioned herein, or by installation thereof, nor shall the city, or any official or employee thereof, be held as assuming any such liability or responsibility by reason of the inspection authorized hereunder or the certificate of approval issued by the inspector. 
(Code 1963, § 20-61) 
Sec. 3-104. - Using existing piping; converting to natural gas. 
    Notwithstanding any provision in this division to the contrary, consumers' piping installed prior to August 20, 1963, or piping installed to supply other than natural gas may be converted to natural gas, if the inspector finds, upon inspection and proper tests, that such piping will render reasonably satisfactory gas service to the consumer and will not in any way endanger life or property; otherwise, such piping shall be altered or replaced, in whole or in part, to conform with the requirements of this division. 
(Code 1963, § 20-64) 
Sec. 3-105. - License, bond required. 
(a)  No persons shall engage in or work at the installation, extension or alteration of consumer's gas piping or certain gas appliances until such persons shall have filed bond and secured license as provided for master plumbing contractors of the city. 
(b)  Nothing herein contained shall be construed as prohibiting an individual from installing or repairing his own appliances or installing, extending, replacing, altering, or repairing consumer's piping on his own premises, or as requiring a license or a bond from an individual doing such work on his own premises; provided, however, all such work must be done in conformity with all other provisions of this division, including those relating to permits, inspections, and fees. 
(Code 1963, § 20-65) 
Sec. 3-106. - Issuance of certificate of approval. 
    The inspector shall issue a certificate of approval at the completion of the work for which a permit for consumer piping has been issued if, after inspection, it is found that such work complies with the provisions of this division. A duplicate of each certificate issued covering consumer's gas piping shall be delivered to the gas company and used as its authority to render gas service. 
(Code 1963, § 20-70) 
Sec. 3-107. - Schedule of permit fees. 
    On all buildings, structures or alterations requiring a gas permit, as set forth in Section 103 of the gas code, a fee shall be paid as required at the time of filing application in accordance with the following schedule: 
(1)  For issuing each permit, a fee of five dollars ($5.00) will be charged; 
(2)  The total fees for inspection of consumer's gas piping at one (1) location (including both rough and final piping inspection) shall be five dollars ($5.00) for one (1) to four (4) outlets, inclusive, and one dollar ($1.00) for each additional outlet; 
(3)  The fees for inspecting conversion burners, floor furnaces, incinerators, boilers, or central heating or air conditioning units shall be five dollars ($5.00) for one (1) unit and one dollar ($1.00) for each additional unit; 
(4)  The fee for inspecting vented wall furnaces and water heaters shall be two dollars and fifty cents ($2.50) for one (1) unit and one dollar ($1.00) for each additional unit; 
(5)  If a reinspection is required an additional fee of five dollars ($5.00) will be charged; 
(6)  If any person commences any work before obtaining the necessary permit and inspection, fees shall be doubled; and 
(7)  Any and all fees shall be paid by the person to whom the permit is issued. 
(Code 1963, § 20-71) 
Sec. 3-108. - Amendments, revisions. 
    That the following sections are hereby revised: 
    Section 101.1. Insert: "City of Gulfport, Mississippi" 
    Section 103. Department of Inspection. Delete in its entirety. 
    Section 106.6.2. Fee schedule. Delete in its entirety. 
    Section 106.6.3. Fee Refunds. Insert at No. 2: "100%;" Insert at No. 3: "100%" 
    Section 108.4. Violation penalties. Delete: "[specify offense], punishable by a fine of not more than [amount] dollars or by imprisonment not exceeding [number of days], or both such fine and imprisonment. Each day that a violation continues after due notice has been served shall be deemed a separate offense." Insert in its place: "misdemeanor in accordance with Section 1-9 General Penalty of the Code of Ordinances of the City of Gulfport, MS." 
    Section 108.5. Stop Work Orders. Delete in last portion of last sentence in paragraph: "liable to a fine of not less than (amount) dollars or more than (amount) dollars." Insert in its place: "guilty of a misdemeanor in accordance with Section 1-9 of the code of Ordinances of the City of Gulfport, MS." 
    Section 109.1. Means of Appeal. Delete "board of appeals" and insert in its place "Construction Board of Adjustment and Appeals (hereinafter "board of appeals")". 
(Ord. No. 2498, § 2, 10-4-06; Ord. No. 2654, §§ 2, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2808, § 2, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2959, § 2, 8-7-18 ) 
Cross reference- International Fuel Gas Code adopted, § 3-101.

DIVISION 3. - PETROLEUM PRODUCTS[5] 

Footnotes: 
--- (5) --- 
Cross reference- Fire prevention and protection, § 10-26 et seq. 
State Law reference- Gasoline and petroleum products, Miss. Code Ann. 1972, § 75-55-1 et seq. 

Sec. 3-126. - Permits for plumbing. 
    Permit for the construction, reconstruction or modification of automobile service stations, marine filling stations, bulk plants or other businesses handling, storing or dispensing petroleum products may be obtained by licensed master plumbers, and all work in connection therewith relating to tanks, pumps, vents, dispensers or other pipe fittings, fixtures or facilities relating to the handling, storing or dispensing of petroleum products shall be performed only under the direct supervision of a licensed master plumber, and in accordance with applicable provisions of all building and other codes of the city. 
(Code 1963, § 20-90) 
Sec. 3-127. - Abandoned facilities. 
    No service station, bulk plant or other business handling, storing or dispensing petroleum products shall abandon any premises without first removing the tanks or other containers in which petroleum products were stored, unless such tanks or other containers have been treated to prevent fire or explosion to the satisfaction of the city plumbing inspector. 
(Code 1963, § 20-91) 
Sec. 3-128. - Fees. 
    In addition to all other fees payable under the provisions of this division, an inspection fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) shall be paid for the inspection of all tanks, pumps, vents, dispensers or any other pipe fitting, fixture or facilities for handling, storing or dispensing petroleum products, and for inspection of abandoned facilities. Only one (1) twenty-five-dollar charge shall be made for each inspection of a service station, filling station, bulk plant or other business. 
(Code 1963, § 20-92) 
Secs. 3-129-3-145. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - MECHANICAL INSTALLATIONS 

Sec. 3-146. - Adoption of code. 
(a)  That certain document, one (1) copy of which is on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport, being marked and designated as the International Mechanical Code, 2018 edition, including Appendix A (See International Mechanical Code Section 101.2.1, 2018 edition), as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the mechanical code of the City of Gulfport, Mississippi, for regulating and governing the design, construction, quality of materials, erection, installation, alteration, repair, location, relocation, replacement, addition to , use or maintenance of mechanical systems in the City of Gulfport; and provide for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the resolutions, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said mechanical code on file in the office of the Building Official of the City of Gulfport are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any prescribed in section 3-157 of this article. 
(b)  Throughout the mechanical code adopted in subsection (a), when reference is made to the duties of a certain official named therein, that designated official of the city who has duties corresponding to those of the named official in such code shall be deemed to be the responsible official insofar as enforcing the provisions of such code are concerned. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-1; Ord. No. 1839, § 1, 5-2-89; Ord. No. 1920, §§ 1-3, 3-2-93; Ord. No. 1971, §§ 1, 3, 10-18-94; Ord. No. 2112, § 1, 11-5-97; Ord. No. 2496, § 1, 10-4-06; Ord. No. 2655, §§ 1, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2806, § 1, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2960, § 1, 8-7-18 ) 
Cross reference- Amendments, revisions, § 3-157. 
Sec. 3-147. - License required. 
    The fee for an air conditioning/heating contractor's license and the fee for a hood and duct contractor's license shall each be one hundred dollars ($100.00). Such licenses must be renewed annually at the first of October. Each licensed air conditioning/heating contractor and hood and duct contractor shall be entitled to renewal of the license at the first of October upon payment of all state, county or city license fees or taxes. A license not reviewed prior to October 1 of any year may be renewed thereafter upon payment of the aforesaid license and taxes and payment of an additional fifty (50) percent of the renewal license fee. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-11; Ord. No. 2309, § 1, 12-19-01; Ord. No. 2331, § 13, 9-12-02; Ord. No. 2675, § 2, 5-4-10) 
Sec. 3-148. - Qualifications of applicant for license. 
    An applicant for an air conditioning/heating contractor's license or a hood and duct contractor's license shall be a citizen of the United States, twenty-one (21) years of age or older; shall have had at least five (5) years' practical experience in the business of installing, maintaining and repairing air conditioning/heating systems or hood and duct systems (whichever is applicable); be an approved installer/technician of the manufacturer of such system and shall successfully complete an examination as herein provided; or be a graduate mechanical engineer from a recognized college or university. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-12; Ord. No. 2309, § 2, 12-19-01; Ord. No. 2675, § 3, 5-4-10) 
Sec. 3-149. - Bond. 
    The holder of any air conditioning or hood and duct license as herein provided for shall, before engaging in business provide a certificate of insurance with public liability insurance having a minimum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) single occurrence/three hundred dollars ($300,000.00) aggregate occurrence with completed product operation coverage having the City of Gulfport a permit holder conditioned upon the faithful performance of his work in accordance with the provisions and requirements of the Code of Ordinances and the appropriate adopted codes and standards. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-13; Ord. No. 2309, § 3, 12-19-01) 
Sec. 3-150. - Duties of air conditioning inspector. 
    It shall be the duty of the air conditioning inspector to examine all plans and specifications required of a contractor and to correct the same when necessary and to approve the same when found to be adequate and sufficient. He shall inspect all work being done in the city and it shall be his responsibility to see that all work is performed in accordance with the provisions of this article, and in the event of the failure of any work to conform to the requirements of this article, it shall be the duty of the air conditioning inspector to stop the work and to require the same to conform to this article. The inspector shall be and he is hereby authorized to enter upon the premises on which any work is being done and make inspections required to be made and otherwise supervise the installation or repair of any air conditioning system. After the satisfactory completion of any such work, it shall be the duty of the air conditioning inspector to issue his certificate of approval. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-14) 
Sec. 3-151. - Plumbing board; rules; meetings, etc. 
    The plumbing board shall have and exercise the following powers and duties: 
(1)  Adopt and promulgate such rules and regulations not inconsistent with this article as may be necessary to carry out the provisions hereof and accomplish the purposes of this article. 
(2)  Set such practical requirements to establish competency of license applicants as may be required and determine the qualifications of all applicants for an air conditioning or hood and duct license. 
(3)  Hold regular meetings on the second Tuesday of each month. They may have special meetings, provided that the meeting has been approved by the city council. Minutes shall be kept on the proceedings of the board. 
(4)  Select one (1) of its members as chairman who shall preside at all meetings and a vice chairman who shall preside in the absence of the chairman. 
(5)  Require applicants to pass the standardized written examination, grant licenses, receive complaints, conduct hearings, revoke licenses, make investigations and recommend to the city council from time to time amendments and changes in mechanical regulations and procedures. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-15; Ord. No. 2085, § 3, 6-3-97; Ord. No. 2309, § 4, 12-19-01) 
Cross reference- General government, Ch. 1. 
Sec. 3-152. - Application form; fee; expiration. 
    Anyone applying for a hood and duct specialty license, before being licensed, shall take the hood and duct examination administered by the plumbing and mechanical board or take the appropriate Mississippi standard contractors examination administered by SBCCI/ICC, of which Gulfport is a participating jurisdiction, and the board must receive a report from SBCCI/ICC that said applicant has received a passing grade on the standard written examination in the required category. Applicant shall pay all examination fees as required by SBCCI/ICC to sit for the standard examination in the required category. The examination fee for the exam administered by the plumbing and mechanical board shall be the same as required by SBCCI/ICC. Any hood and duct license shall be in force and effect for one (1) year unless revoked. Each hood and duct license shall be entitled to renewal of license prior to its expiration and provided it is not revoked. The hood and duct license [fee] shall be seventy-five dollars ($75.00) annually. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-16; Ord. No. 2085, § 3, 6-3-97; Ord. No. 2309, § 5, 12-19-01) 
Sec. 3-153. - Owner doing his own work to obtain a permit. 
    Any owner, authorized agent, or contractor who desires to construct, enlarge, alter, repair, move, demolish, or change the occupancy of a building or structure, or to erect, install, enlarge, alter, repair, remove, convert, or replace any mechanical system, the installation of which is regulated by the technical SBCCI Mechanical Code, or to cause any such work to be done, shall first make application to the building official and obtain the required permit for the work. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-17; Ord. No. 2085, § 3, 6-3-97; Ord. No. 2309, § 6, 12-19-01) 
Sec. 3-154. - Appeals. 
    The board established hereunder shall, in addition to its other duties, serve as an appeal board to hear the appeal of any person aggrieved by any decision or ruling of the plumbing inspector, provided that notice of such appeal is given the chairman of the board and the plumbing inspector at the office of the director of the plumbing department of the city within forty-eight (48) hours after the decision or ruling has been made. In case of an appeal, the secretary shall transmit copies thereof together with any substantiating data to each member of the board. The appeal shall be heard at the next regular or called meeting of the board. 
    An aggrieved party may appear in person or by counsel and any decision of such board acting as an appeal board shall be final unless appeal is made to the city council within ten (10) days thereafter. 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-18) 
Sec. 3-155. - Provisions governing installation, repair, etc. 
    The applicable provisions of the electrical code, building code, plumbing code, gas code, fire prevention code and mechanical code adopted by the city and in force shall govern the installation, alteration, repair, maintenance and testing of an air conditioning system and/or heating system or any component parts thereof. In addition to applicable provisions of such codes the following shall also apply: 
The ASHRAE Guide and Date Book -Applications, 1966-67; Fundamentals and equipment 1965 and 1966; and ASHRAE Handbook of Fundamentals, 1967, adopted and promulgated by the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers. 
    Also the following promulgated by the National Fire Protection Association: 
Standard 89-M -"Standard Installation Clearances, Inches, for Heat-Producing Appliances," Edition of 1966. 
Standard 90A- "Installation of Air Conditioning and Ventilation Systems of Other Than Residence Types," Edition of 1967. 
Standard 90B- "Warm Air Heating and Air Conditioning Residence Type," Edition of 1965. 
Standard 91- "Blowers and Exhaust Systems." 
Standard 96- "Restaurant Cooking, especially Ventilation." 
(Code 1963, § 21/2-19) 
Cross reference- Adoption of specific NFPA standards, § 10-46.1.

Sec. 3-157. - Amendments, revisions. 
    That the following sections are hereby revised: 
    Section 101.1. Insert: "City of Gulfport, Mississippi" 
    Section 103. Department of Mechanical Inspection. Delete in its entirety. 
    Section 106.5.2. Fee schedule . Delete in its entirety. 
    Section 106.5.3. Fee Refunds. Insert at No. 2: "100%;" Insert at No. 3: "100%"

Each day that a violation continues after due notice has been served shall be deemed a separate offense." Insert in its place: "misdemeanor in accordance with Section 1-9 General Penalty of the Code of Ordinances of the City of Gulfport, MS."

Insert in its place: "guilty of a misdemeanor in accordance with Section 1-9 of the code of Ordinances of the City of Gulfport, MS." 
    Section 109.1. Means of Appeal. Delete "board of appeals" and insert in its place "Construction Board of Adjustment and Appeals (hereinafter "board of appeals")". 
(Ord. No. 2496, § 2, 10-4-06; Ord. No. 2655, §§ 2, 3, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2806, § 2, 12-2-14 ; Ord. No. 2960, § 3, 8-7-18 )
