Any Basement-level space required for compliance with Flood Ordinance requirements in excess of 8 feet and not contained within a filled foundation or chain-wall foundation shall be designed for use as (i) parking or storage space set into the structure into the second and deeper Layers, and concealed from view from all streets, (ii) an open market, loggia, porch, or combination thereof, or other open-air area for recreation, relaxation or gathering, (iii) enclosed commercial or retail space to the extent permitted by applicable FEMA requirements and T3 Zone usage limits, or other use permitted by the Planning Office. 
5.3.3  Building Function & Density (T3) 
a.  Buildings in each Transect Zone shall conform to the Functions described in Table 10 or 11 and Section 5.3.11. Functions that do not conform to the requirements of Tables 10 and 11 shall require approval by Warrant or by Variance. 
b.  Function Volume accommodated on a lot shall be limited by the ability of available parking to meet the parking requirement corresponding to the Function Volume. However, under no circumstances may the Function Volume accommodated on the lot exceed the Density Allowance for that lot. 
c.  The parking requirement for any Function associated with a building may be reduced where on-site parking spaces required for two distinct Functions are physically and practicably accessible within the same facility to vehicles associated with the different uses. To compute the reduction in required spaces for each of the two Functions, divide the smaller of the parking requirements for the two Functions by the appropriate Sharing Factor from Table 12, then subtract the result from the smaller of the two parking requirements. This difference is one-half the Effective Parking Bonus, and the original parking requirement for each of the two Functions may be reduced by one-half the Effective Parking Bonus. Effective Parking Bonuses shall only be available for distinct Functions pair-wise. To qualify for any Effective Parking Bonus, all parking spaces included in the calculation for both Functions shall be on the usage site generating the requirements, publicly available, and mutually accessible. 
d.  Within the Long Pedestrian Shed of a TOD, the Effective Parking available for calculating the Function Volume on each lot may be increased by twenty-five percent (25%), or conversely the parking requirement for a particular Function Volume may be reduced by twenty percent (20%). 
e.  [RESERVED] 
f.  [RESERVED] 
g.  A Home Occupation operated by the property owner is permitted by right in any single Story or Outbuilding of a fee-simple lot, subject to the functional limitations stated in Article 7 Definitions and the parking limitations stated in Table 11. Home Occupation requires two (2) parking spaces in addition to the residential parking requirements for the lot in T3 Zones. 
h.  An Outbuilding may be used as an Ancillary Dwelling Unit subordinate to the Principal Building in a T3 zone subject to the following restrictions: 
1.  One (1) additional parking space shall be provided to accommodate the use of the Outbuilding; and 
2.  The primary residence of the property owner shall be either the Principal Unit or the Ancillary Dwelling Unit of the property for more than 6 months of the year; and 
3.  A covenant shall be executed by the property owner stipulating that the Ancillary Dwelling Unit usage of the Outbuilding will be discontinued if the owner's principal residence is removed from the property for more than six months, and a copy of this covenant shall be submitted to the Planning Office. 
i.  An Outbuilding shall not be counted as an Independent Residence Unit so long as it is used in accordance with the provisions of this Code. 
j.  Adjusted Density shall be further modified and limited according to Section 5.3.12. 
5.3.4  Parking Standards (T3) 
a.  Vehicular parking shall be required and adjusted for mixed-use as shown in Tables 11 and 12 and Sections 5.1.9 and 5.3.3. 
b.  Publicly available on-street parking along the Frontage Lines of a lot shall be counted toward the parking requirement of the building on that lot subject to the requirement that the lot owner provides and dedicates to the City parking meters and street tree plantings along the Frontage Lines according to the specifications of the Community Plan and the CRC. 
c.  Maximum parking ratios may be established by the CRC. 
d.  [RESERVED] 
e.  [RESERVED] 
f.  Open parking areas shall be located at the Second and Third Lot Layers, as shown in Table 16D, except that Driveway aprons and drop-offs may be located at the First Layer. Garages shall be located at the Third Layer. 
g.  Parking shall be accessed by the Alley or Rear Lane when such are available on the Community Plan. 
h.  [RESERVED] 
i.  View of parking lots and parking structures shall be masked from the Frontage by a Liner Building or other buildings or by a Streetscreen as specified in Section 5.3.5b. Parking requirements shall be waived for Functions in Liner Buildings of twenty-five (25) feet depth or less constructed to screen Public-Parking Facilities. 
j.  Reduction of impervious surfaces through the use of interlocking pavers, compacted oyster shell, or other pervious paving on a list of materials approved and maintained by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect shall be permitted by right for all surface parking in T3 Zones and required for all surface parking lots accommodating more than four (4) vehicles in T3 Zones. 
k.  [RESERVED] 
l.  For buildings on Secondary Grids (S-Grids), parking lots may be allowed on the Frontage by Warrant (see Section 5.8.1a). 
m.  The required parking may be provided within one-quarter mile of the site that it serves, subject to approval by Warrant. For single-family residences (including those with Ancillary Dwelling Units), parking spaces in front of garages, and stacked spaces in driveways, shall be counted toward the parking requirement. 
n.  [RESERVED] 
o.  [RESERVED] 
p.  [RESERVED] 
q.  [RESERVED] 
5.3.5  Architectural Standards (T3) 
The following are general city-wide requirements, and may be modified or overruled by Community Architectural Guidelines adopted as part of the Official Community Plan: 
a.  Building wall materials may be combined on each Facade only horizontally, with the heavier below the lighter, relative weights being determined for approved materials by the Urban Design Center. 
b.  Streetscreens should be between 4 and 8 feet in height and constructed of a material matching the adjacent building Facade. The Streetscreen may be replaced by Warrant by a hedge or fence design approved by the Urban Design Center or the City Architect. Streetscreens shall have openings no larger than necessary to allow automobile and pedestrian access. A single length of Streetscreen along a Frontage, including any pedestrian and vehicle openings, may be no longer than 75 feet maximum. 
c.  All openings, including porches, galleries, arcades and windows, with the exception of storefronts, shall be square or vertical in proportion, with width no greater than height. Bungalows may have horizontally proportioned intercolumniation, with width exceeding height. 
d.  For Facades, openings above the first Story shall not exceed 50% of the total building wall area, with each Facade being calculated independently. 
e.  [RESERVED]. 
f.  Doors and windows that operate as sliders are prohibited on Facades. 
g.  [RESERVED] 
h.  Pitched roofs, if provided, shall be symmetrically sloped no less than 5:12, except that porches and attached sheds may be no less than 2:12. 
i.  Flat roofs shall be enclosed by parapets a minimum of 42 inches high, or higher as required to conceal mechanical equipment to the satisfaction of the CRC. 
j.  The exterior finish material on all Facades shall be limited to brick, wood siding, cementitious siding and/or stucco; to wood trim, cementitious trim, painted solid PVC or urethane trim, or similar painted solid synthetic trim; or to such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
k.  Balconies and porches on Facades or facing Frontages shall be made of painted wood or wrought iron, or shall be clad in painted solid PVC, urethane, or similar painted solid synthetic trim, or shall be constructed of or clad in such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
l.  Fences, if provided at the First Layer, shall be painted. Fences at Lot Lines may be of wood board; fences may be chain link only in the Third Layer. Hedges backed with black-clad chain link fence, designed so that the fence will be fully obscured by the mature hedge, may be used in the Second Layer. 
m.  Subject to the other requirements of this Code, including without limitation Article 5, any building designed in a manner consistent with the publication entitled "A Pattern Book for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods" shall be permitted as of right, on certification of such by the Urban Design Center or City Architect. 
n.  Within any Historic District established or recognized by the Mayor and City Council, or with respect to any Historic Structure or Historic Site so established or recognized, each building and structure, and its improvement, alteration, addition, or reconstruction, shall comply with the Historical Architectural Guidelines of the City's Historical Commission, if one is established by an Ordinance approved by the Mayor and City Council, and shall be subject to approval by the City Architect and the Historical Commission. 
o.  Within any Community Planning Area subject to Community Plans which require Architectural Review in some or all districts, buildings other than single-family residences and their associated ancillary buildings shall be subject to approval of the City Architect in accordance with the City's Architectural Review Ordinance if such exists. 
5.3.6  Environmental Standards (T3) 
a.  Transect Zones manifest a range of responses to natural and urban conditions. In case of conflict, to the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, the natural infrastructure shall have priority in the more rural zones (T1-T3) and the urban infrastructure shall have priority in the more urban zones (T4-T6) as detailed in Sections 5.2 through 5.6. 
b.  The landscape installed shall consist primarily of native species requiring minimal irrigation, fertilization and maintenance. 
c.  Impermeable surface shall be minimized and confined to the ratio of lot coverage by building shown in Table 14H. 
d.  To the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, city ordinance, or overlay district requirement, the management of storm water shall be primarily through retention and percolation on the individual lot or through swales in the Public Frontage wherever technically feasible. 
e.  Within Advisory, Special, or Community Flood Hazard Areas designated by the City's Flood Damage Protection Ordinance, foundations for single-family residential dwelling units shall not employ slab-on-grade or slab-on-chain-wall construction. Raised Floor on pier-and-beam, pile, or stem-wall foundations shall be permitted. 
5.3.7  Landscape Standards (T3) 
a.  A minimum of one tree to match the species of street trees on the Public Frontage shall be planted within the First Layer for each 30 feet of Frontage Line as illustrated in Table 16D. 
b.  [RESERVED]. 
c.  [RESERVED]. 
d.  Trees shall be of various species, naturalistically clustered, with understory plantings. Lawn constituting over 50% of the Private Frontage area shall only be permitted by Warrant. 
5.3.8  Signage Standards (T3) 
a.  All provisions of the City's separate Comprehensive Sign Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, according to the City of Gulfport's Code of Ordinances, Article IV. Signs, Chapter 9 Planning and Development, section 9-89, Signs in R-1, R-1-15, R-1-10, R-1-7.5, R-2, R-3, R-4, R-E districts. 
(Ord. No. 2627, § 2, 4-22-09) 
5.3.9  Ambient Standards (T3) 
a.  Sound levels measured at the building Frontage shall not exceed 65 decibels from sunrise to sunset and 55 decibels from sunset to sunrise. All provisions of the City of Gulfport Noise Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, and where in conflict herewith, the stricter provision shall apply. 
b.  Permanent Outdoor Luminaires other than those which are located under cover of an opaque Canopy or which are Fully Shielded shall be so equipped as not to exceed a total lamp power of 60 Watts per Luminaire for Incandescent Lamps, or of 15 Watts per Luminaire for non-Incandescent Lamps. 
c.  The mounting height of a permanent outdoor Luminaire which is attached directly to the Facade or Elevation of a building shall not exceed 12 feet, where mounting height is measured from the top-most point of the Luminaire. For a permanent outdoor Luminaire supported by any other means, mounting height shall be limited to the lesser of one-third the distance from the Luminaire to any property line or 25 feet, adjustable by Warrant. 
d.  Streetlights shall be Fully Shielded or Nearly Fully Shielded and of a general type illustrated in Table 5. 
e.  Outdoor storage shall be screened from view from any Frontage by a Streetscreen in conformance with Section 5.3.5b. 
5.3.10 [RESERVED] 
  
5.3.12  Building-Scale Density Limits, Transfers, and Bonuses (T3) 
a.  No more than one Independent Residential Unit shall be constructed on a lot in a T3 Zone, subject to the building configuration limitations of 5.3.2. 
b.  No lot in a T3 Zone shall qualify as a Receiving Area for either Density Bonus or Density Transfer. A Density Bonus accruing to a lot in a T3 Zone may be transferred to a property within a Density Bonus Receiving Area as designated by the lot owner. 
c.  Lots in T3 Zones may be designated on the Official Community Plan as Density Sending Areas. Such a lot carries Density Rights to one (1) Equivalent Housing Unit. The Density Transfer transaction shall be handled in accordance with Section 1.7.3. 
5.4 - SPECIFIC TO GENERAL URBAN TRANSECT ZONES (T4L, T4+) 
    Transect zone T4 includes two variational Subzones: T4-Limited ("T4L Zone" or "T4L") and T4-Open ("T4+ Zone" or "T4+"). Requirements for these two Subzones are similar, differing primarily in Function Intensities permitted and in Building Disposition parameters (specifically setbacks). Wherever Transect Zone T4 is referred to within this Code, it refers to both the T4L and the T4+ variational Subzones. 
5.4.1  Building Disposition (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Newly platted lots shall be dimensioned according to Section 5.4.11a or b. 
b.  Buildings shall be disposed in relation to the boundaries of their lots according to Section 5.4.11a or b. 
c.  One Principal Building at the Frontage and one Outbuilding to the rear of the Principal Building may be built on each lot as shown in Table 16C, with the exception of the Cottage Court Special Building Type described in Section 5.4.13. In addition a detached garage accessed from the rear of the lot via a Service Lane may be built in accordance with the Outbuilding disposition requirements. In addition, for Building Types other than Cottage Court, a second Outbuilding is permitted in the Third Layer if one of the Outbuildings is a detached garage, if its Disposition complies with required Outbuilding Disposition, if such detached garage is accessed via a Service Alley or Lane, and if Principal Building, detached garage, and other Outbuilding are each separated from one another by at least 10 feet. 
d.  Lot coverage by building shall not exceed that shown in Section 5.4.11a or b. 
e.  Facades shall be built parallel to a rectilinear Principal Frontage Line or parallel to the tangent of a curved Principal Frontage Line, or perpendicular to side lot lines, and where possible shall choose the alignment to match that of Facades on neighboring lots. Facade alignment shall comply with any requirements indicated in the Community Plan. In Zone 4+ only, Facades shall be built out along a minimum of 60% of the length of the Principal Frontage Line as measured at the maximum required Setback. 
f.  Setbacks for Principal Buildings shall be as shown in Table 14I for Zones T4 and T4+, as appropriate. In the case of an Infill lot, front Setbacks shall match one or the other of the existing adjacent Setbacks, so long as the resulting Setback is allowed by Table 14I. Setbacks may otherwise be adjusted by Warrant. 
g.  Rear Setbacks for Outbuildings shall be a minimum of 15 feet measured from the centerline of the Alley or Rear Lane easement. In the absence of Rear Alley or Lane, the rear Setback shall be as shown in Section 5.4.11a or b. 
h.  Building Types shall be as shown in Table 9, with the addition of the Cottage Court Special Building Type as described in Section 5.4.13. 
i.  A minimum Residential housing mix of three Types (none less than 20%) shall be required in the General Urban Zone T4-Open (T4+), selected from Table 9, with the addition of the Cottage Court Special Building Type as described in Section 5.4.13. 
5.4.2  Building Configuration (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Private Frontage types shall conform to and be allocated in accordance with Table 7 and Section 5.4.11a or b. 
b.  Awnings may encroach the public sidewalk without limit. Stoops may encroach 100% of the depth of a Setback. Open porches and awnings may encroach up to 50% of the depth of the Setback. Balconies and bay windows may encroach up to 25% of the depth of the Setback. 
c.  Loading docks and service areas shall be permitted on Frontages only by Warrant. 
d.  Building Heights shall conform to Table 8 and be as shown in Sections 5.4.11a or b for Zones T4 or T4+, respectively. 
e.  [RESERVED] 
f.  Building Height shall be measured from the Height Baseline appropriate to the site: outside Flood Hazard Areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the average grade at the primary Frontage Line for the lot; inside Flood Hazard Areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the Minimum Buildable Elevation. The vertical offset between the Height Baseline and the finish surface of the first floor above the Height Baseline shall not exceed four (4) feet. 
g.  No Story shall exceed 14 feet in height, measured from floor to ceiling. 
h.  Any Basement-level space required for compliance with Flood Ordinance requirements in excess of 8 feet and not contained within a filled foundation or chain-wall foundation shall be designed for use as (i) parking or storage space set into the structure into the second and deeper Layers, and concealed from view from all streets, (ii) an open market, loggia, porch, or combination thereof, or other open-air area for recreation, relaxation or gathering, (iii) enclosed commercial or retail space to the extent permitted by applicable FEMA requirements and applicable T4L or T4+ Zone usage limits, or other use permitted by the Planning Office. 
5.4.3  Building Function & Density (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Buildings in each Transect Zone shall conform to the Functions described in Tables 10 and 11 and Sections 5.4.11a or b. Functions that do not conform to the requirements of Tables 10 and 11 shall require approval by Warrant or by Variance. 
b.  Function Volume accommodated on a lot shall be limited by the ability of Available Parking to meet the parking requirement corresponding to the Function Volume. However, under no circumstances may the Function Volume accommodated on the lot exceed the Density Allowance for that lot. 
c.  The parking requirement for any Function associated with a building may be reduced where on-site parking spaces required for two distinct Functions are physically and practicably accessible within the same facility to vehicles associated with the different uses. To compute the reduction in spaces required for each of the two Functions, divide the smaller of the parking requirements for the two Functions by the appropriate Sharing Factor from Table 12, then subtract the result from the smaller of the two parking requirements. This difference is one-half the Effective Parking Bonus, and the original parking requirement for each of the two Functions may be reduced by one-half the Effective Parking Bonus. Effective Parking Bonuses shall only be permitted for distinct Functions pairwise. To qualify for any Effective Parking Bonus, the parking spaces included in the calculation for both Functions shall be on the usage site generating the requirements, publicly available, and mutually accessible. 
d.  Within the Long Pedestrian Shed of a TOD, the Effective Parking available for calculating the Function Volume permitted on each lot may be increased by twenty-five percent (25%), or conversely, the parking requirement for a particular Function Volume may be reduced by twenty percent (20%). 
e.  Accessory uses of Limited Lodging, Limited Office, and Ancillary Dwelling Unit shall be permitted within an Outbuilding. 
f.  [RESERVED] 
g.  A Home Occupation operated by the property owner is permitted by right in any single Story or Outbuilding of a fee-simple lot, subject to the functional limitations stated in Article 7 (Definitions) and the parking limitations stated in Table 11. Home Occupation requires one (1) parking space in addition to the residential parking requirements for the lot in T4 Zones. 
h.  [RESERVED] 
i.  [RESERVED] 
j.  Adjusted Density is further modified and limited according to Section 5.4.12. 
5.4.4  Parking Standards (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Vehicular parking shall be required as shown in Tables 11 and 12 in conjunction with Sections 5.1.9 and 5.4.3. 
b.  Publicly available on-street parking along the Frontage Lines of a lot shall be counted toward the parking requirement of the building on the lot subject to the requirement that the lot owner provides and dedicates to the City parking meters and street tree plantings along the Frontage Lines according to the specifications of the Community Plan and the CRC. 
c.  Maximum Parking ratios may be established by the CRC. 
d.  [RESERVED] 
e.  Bicycle rack space for a minimum of one (1) bicycle shall be provided within the Public or Private Frontage for every seven vehicular parking spaces provided in T4 Zones. 
f.  All parking areas except for Driveways shall be located at the Third Lot Layers, as shown in Table 16D. Garages shall be located at the Third Layer. 
g.  Parking shall be accessed by the Alley or Rear Lane when such are available on the Community Plan. 
h.  [RESERVED] 
i.  View of parking lots and parking garages shall be masked from the Frontage by a Liner Building or other buildings or by a Streetscreen as specified in Section 5.4.5b. Parking requirements shall be waived for Functions in Liner Buildings of twenty-five (25) feet depth or less constructed to screen Public-Parking Facilities. 
j.  Reduction of impervious surfaces through the use of interlocking pavers, compacted oyster shell, or other pervious paving on a list of materials approved and maintained by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect shall be permitted by right for all surface parking in T4 Zones. 
k.  [RESERVED] 
l.  For buildings on Secondary Grids (S-Grids), parking lots may be allowed on the Frontage by Warrant (see Section 5.8.1a). 
m.  Required parking may be provided within one-quarter mile of the site that it serves by right in Zone 4+, and subject to approval by Warrant in Zone 4L. For single-family residences, including those with Ancillary Dwelling Units, parking spaces in front of garages, and stacked spaces in driveways, shall be counted toward the parking requirement. 
n.  [RESERVED]. 
o.  For T4+ Zones within an Unbundled Parking Area, all on-site parking spaces shall be provided as part of a Public-Parking Facility except for single-family residential units. 
p.  [RESERVED] 
q.  [RESERVED] 
5.4.5  Architectural Standards (T4L, T4+) 
The following are general city-wide requirements, and may be modified or overruled by Community Architectural Guidelines adopted as part of the Official Community Plan: 
a.  Building wall materials may be combined on each Facade only horizontally, with the heavier below the lighter, relative weights being determined for approved materials by the Urban Design Center. 
b.  Streetscreens should be between 4 and 8 feet in height and constructed of a material matching the adjacent building Facade. The Streetscreen may be replaced by a hedge or fence by Warrant. Streetscreens shall have openings no larger than necessary to allow automobile and pedestrian access. A single length of Streetscreen along a Frontage, including any pedestrian and vehicle openings, may be no longer than 50 feet maximum. 
c.  All openings, including porches, galleries, arcades and windows, with the exception of storefronts, shall be square or vertical in proportion, with width no greater than height. Bungalows may have horizontally proportioned intercolumniation, with width exceeding height. 
d.  For each Facade, openings above the first Story shall not exceed 50% of the total building wall area, with each Facade being calculated independently. 
e.  [RESERVED]. 
f.  Doors and windows that operate as sliders are prohibited on Facades. 
g.  No Unarticulated length of Facade at street level shall exceed fifteen (15) feet. 
h.  Pitched roofs, if provided, shall be symmetrically sloped no less than 5:12, except that porches and attached sheds may be no less than 2:12. 
i.  Flat roofs shall be enclosed by parapets a minimum of 42 inches high, or higher as required to conceal mechanical equipment to the satisfaction of the CRC. 
j.  The exterior finish material on all Facades shall be limited to brick, wood siding, cementitious siding and/or stucco; to wood trim, cementitious trim, painted solid PVC or urethane trim, or similar painted solid synthetic trim; or to such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
k.  Balconies and porches shall be made of painted wood or wrought iron, or shall be clad in painted solid PVC, urethane, or similar painted solid synthetic trim, or shall be constructed of or clad in such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
l.  Fences, if provided within the First Lot Layer, shall be painted or shall be of wrought iron, or of other materials on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. Fences at other Layers may be of wood board or chain link. Hedges backed with black-clad chain link fence designed so that the fence will be fully obscured by the mature hedge shall be permitted by Warrant. 
m.  Subject to the other requirements of this Code, including without limitation Article 5, any building designed in a manner consistent with the publication entitled "A Pattern Book for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods" shall be permitted as of right on certification of such by the Urban Design Center or City Architect. 
n.  Within any Historic District established or recognized by the Mayor and City Council, or with respect to any Historic Structure or Historic Site so established or recognized, each building and structure, and its improvement, alteration, addition, or reconstruction, shall comply with the Historical Architectural Guidelines of the City Historical Preservation Commission, if one has been established by an Ordinance approved by the Mayor and City Council, and shall be subject to approval by the City Architect and the Historical Commission. 
o.  Within any Community Planning Area subject to Community Plans which require Architectural Review in some or all districts, buildings other than single-family residences and their associated ancillary buildings shall be subject to approval of the City Architect in accordance with the City's Architectural Review Ordinance if such exists. 
5.4.6  Environmental Standards (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Transect Zones manifest a range of responses to natural and urban conditions. In case of conflict, to the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, the natural infrastructure shall have priority in the more rural zones (T1-T3) and the urban infrastructure shall have priority in the more urban zones (T4-T6) as detailed in Sections 5.2 through 5.6. 
b.  The species of landscape installed shall consist primarily of durable native species tolerant of soil compaction. 
c.  Impermeable surface shall be confined to the ratio of lot coverage by building, as shown in Table 14H. 
d.  To the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, city ordinance, or overlay district requirements, management of storm water shall be primarily off-site through underground storm drainage and there shall be no retention or detention required on the individual lot. 
e.  Within Advisory, Special, or Community Flood Hazard Areas designated by the City's Flood Damage Protection Ordinance, foundations for single-family residential dwelling units shall not employ slab-on-grade or slab-on-chain-wall construction. Raised Floor on pier-and-beam, pile, or stem-wall foundations shall be permitted. 
5.4.7  Landscape Standards (T4L, T4+) 
a.  A minimum of one tree to match the species of street trees on the Public Frontage shall be planted within the First Layer for each 30 feet of Frontage Line as illustrated in Table 16D. 
b.  [RESERVED]. 
c.  [RESERVED]. 
d.  Trees shall be of species matching the planting on the Public Frontage as shown in Table 4. Lawn shall be permitted. 
e.  Trees and shrubs on a list of invasive, problematic, or undesirable species maintained by the Urban Design Center shall not be used in any Frontage Landscaping in Zone T4L or in any Landscaping of any kind in Zone T4+. 
5.4.8  Signage Standards (T4L, T4+) 
a.  All provisions of the City's separate Comprehensive Sign Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, according to the City of Gulfport's Code of Ordinances, Article IV. Signs, Chapter 9 Planning and Development, section 9-90, Signs in R-B and R-O districts. 
(Ord. No. 2627, § 3, 4-21-09) 
5.4.9  Ambient Standards (T4L, T4+) 
a.  Sound levels measured at the building Frontage shall not exceed 65 decibels from sunrise to sunset and 55 decibels from sunset to sunrise. All provisions of the City of Gulfport Noise Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, and where in conflict herewith, the stricter provision shall apply. 
b.  Permanent outdoor Luminaires other than those which are located under cover of an opaque Canopy or which are Fully Shielded shall be so equipped as not to exceed a total lamp power of 40 Watts per Luminaire for Incandescent Lamps, or of 10 Watts per Luminaire for non-Incandescent Lamps. A Luminaire under cover of an opaque Canopy may be so equipped as to exceed a total lamp power of 40 Watts Incandescent or 10 Watts non-Incandescent only if the lamp or lamps are not visible from any property line. 
c.  The mounting height of a permanent outdoor Luminaire which is attached directly to the Facade or Elevation of a building shall not exceed 12 feet, where mounting height is measured from the top-most point of the Luminaire. For a permanent outdoor Luminaire supported by any other means, mounting height shall be limited to the lesser of one-third the distance from the Luminaire to any property line or 25 feet, adjustable by Warrant. 
d.  Streetlights shall be Fully Shielded or Nearly Fully Shielded and of a general type illustrated in Table 5. 
e.  Outdoor storage shall be screened from view from any Frontage by a Streetscreen in conformance with Section 5.4.5b. 
5.4.10 [RESERVED] 
  
  
5.4.12  Building-Scale Density Limits, Transfers, and Bonuses (T4L, T4+) 
a.  [RESERVED] 
b.  Lots within T4 Zones shall be eligible for inclusion in both Density Transfer Receiving Areas and Density Bonus Receiving Areas as designated on the Community Plan. Lots within T4 Zones shall not be eligible for Additional Height Allowances. 
c.  Lots in T4 Zones may be designated on the Community Plan as Density Sending Areas. Such a lot carries Density Rights equal to the By-Right Density Allowance for the lot. The Density Transfer transaction shall be handled in accordance with the Section 1.7.3. 
5.4.13  Cottage Court Special Building Type Exception 
a.  The Cottage Court Special Building Type may be built by right in any T4L or T4+ Zone outside of Flood Hazard Areas designated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance. 
b.  General. The Cottage Court Building Type shall comprise no fewer than 4 and no more than 12 Residential single-family dwelling structures ("Cottages") arrayed about a common rectangular central courtyard, along with up to 4 ancillary Outbuildings at the rear of the lot in accordance with Table 9A. Cottages shall Enfront at least two sides and at most three sides of the courtyard. The maximum number of structures in a Cottage Court development shall be 12, not including an optional Gazebo; the maximum number of dwelling units incorporated shall be 12. 
c.  Composite Lots. A Cottage Court may be laid out and constructed over multiple abutting lots under common ownership without re-subdivision subject to approval of the layout by the City Architect. In such case covenants shall be recorded for the lots in accordance with provision 5.4.13m. The lot or assembly of lots commonly owned and occupied by the Cottage Court shall be referred to herein as the Composite Lot. 
d.  Disposition: General. Cottage Courts shall be disposed according to Table 9A, with a minimum of four Cottages arranged along at least two opposing sides of a central rectangular common courtyard. The rear of the courtyard may be Enfronted with Cottages, with Outbuildings, or with a visual screen. Consultation with the Urban Design Center is recommended, and review and approval of the site plan by the City Architect is required. The Cottage Court Special Building Type shall not be permitted on a corner lot. Interior lot lines between lots comprising the Composite Lot may be ignored for the purposes of determining Building Disposition. 
e.  Disposition: Courtyard. The minimum Unobstructed Courtyard Width shall be 16 feet, and a minimum of 16 feet of space unobstructed by other structures shall be provided in front of each Cottage Facade Enfronting the courtyard. Courtyard width shall not exceed 75 feet, measured Facade to Facade. The common courtyard shall Enfront the street, and no Cottage shall be placed between street and courtyard. Minimum courtyard depth shall be 40 feet, measured from the Frontage line to the nearest Facade or screen which defines the courtyard rear. Every wall of every structure in the Cottage Court which Enfronts, partially Enfronts, or visibly faces the courtyard shall be a Facade. Facades of Cottages and Outbuildings Enfronting the courtyard along any side shall align; however porches and stoops may impinge on the courtyard by up to 8 feet subject to the Unobstructed Courtyard Width requirement. All Cottages shall be oriented with primary entrances from the central common courtyard. The two frontmost cottages shall have Facades Enfronting the street as well as the courtyard. 
f.  Disposition: Structures. Cottages and Outbuildings shall be arranged to provide side setbacks for the Composite Lot of at least 3 feet in all T4 Zones, independent of the setback requirements of the corresponding Transect Zone. Front and rear setbacks for the Composite Lot shall be determined by the corresponding Transect Zone. Cottages shall be separated one from another by no less than six (6) feet. A common Gazebo may be included in the courtyard near the Frontage Line subject to the front setback requirements for the corresponding Transect Zone. Outbuildings shall be located in the Fourth Layer behind the common courtyard, separated one from another and from Cottages by no less than ten (10) feet. 
g.  Configuration: Cottages. Cottage Building Height shall be limited to three (3) Stories, with Cottage size subject to the following constraints: No first Story shall exceed 800 square feet of Conditioned Interior Space; no two-Story Cottage shall exceed 1,200 square feet and no three-Story Cottage shall exceed 1,300 square feet of Conditioned Interior Space; no third Story shall exceed 120 square feet in area. 
h.  Configuration: Outbuildings. Outbuildings other than Carriage Houses shall be limited to two (2) Stories height. Carriage House apartments shall be permitted over a garage, storage, or other unoccupied ancillary use, but shall constitute no more than one third (1/3) the total number of dwelling units in the Cottage Court. Carriage House units shall have their primary entrances from the courtyard. Outbuildings which are Carriage Houses shall be limited to three (3) stories in height. A single Carriage House Outbuilding shall include no more than two (2) dwelling units and no more than 1,500 square feet of Conditioned Interior Space on the second and higher floors. The total third Story floor area of a Carriage House Outbuilding shall not exceed 600 square feet, and no contiguous third Story area shall exceed 400 square feet. 
i.  Function and Density. A Density Bonus of 2.0 units shall be granted to a Cottage Court development of up to 12 dwelling units maximum, but the total number of dwellings on the Composite Lot shall otherwise be limited to the total Density Allowance for the comprising lots. However, the component lots may individually exceed their Density Allowance limits. The actual Building-Scale Density for a Cottage Court shall not be less than 10 units per acre. Functional requirements shall be as specified by the corresponding Transect Zone. Limited Office and Limited Lodging Functions shall be permitted in Outbuildings. 
j.  Parking. Parking shall be accessed from a Rear Alley or Service Lane and shall be located in the Fourth Layer and to the rear of the common courtyard, whether provided by surface lot, by covered parking, or by garage. Parking shall be screened from the courtyard and from abutting properties by visually opaque walls, fencing, landscaping, Building Facades, or some combination thereof. The parking requirement for a Cottage Court Special Building Type shall be 1.0 spaces per dwelling unit for Residential Functions. Curb parking along the Frontage shall not be counted toward the parking requirement. No Driveway or parking apron shall be allowed outside the Fourth Layer. At least one bicycle rack space per dwelling unit, plus two additional spaces, shall be provided for a Cottage Court. No parking shall be permitted in the courtyard, between cottages, or between cottages and Outbuildings or parking screens. Garages or parking covers, if provided, shall meet the Disposition requirements of Outbuildings according to Table 9A and shall present Facades to the common courtyard. Outbuildings may include Carriage House dwelling units on second and third floors. 
k.  Architectural. Design of all structures in a Cottage Court shall be coordinated and shall employ complimentary materials. Consultation with the Urban Design Center is recommended; design approval by the City Architect of Facades, Elevations, layout, and landscaping and screening shall be required. The City Architect shall review and approve designs exhibiting general architectural excellence in compliance with any applicable Community Architectural Guidelines or with the publication entitled "A Pattern Book for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods". A Gazebo included in the courtyard shall meet the architectural standards for a porch on a Facade. 
l.  Landscaping and screening. A Cottage Court shall include at least one pedestrian walkway of minimum width five feet (5 ft.) running the length of the courtyard and providing pedestrian access to each Cottage. The courtyard shall be landscaped with the greater of one (1) tree per 800 square feet of courtyard area or two (2) trees, and with lawn, groundcover, understory shrubs, or some combination thereof. The courtyard may be separated from the Public Frontage by a painted wood picket fence not to exceed 4 feet height or by a visually open fence of wrought iron or other material approved by the City Architect at a height not to exceed 8 feet. Rear elevations of cottages shall either meet the architectural requirements of Facades or shall be screened from view from adjacent properties by a visually opaque fence, wall, or plantings to a minimum height of six (6) feet along side lot lines of the Composite Lot. Parking areas to the rear shall be screened from view from the courtyard and from adjacent properties in accordance with provision 5.4.13j. 
m.  Covenants. For Cottage Courts constructed on Composite Lots, CRC approval shall be contingent on recording of covenants preventing sale of individual component lots, and preventing re-subdivision of such lots except to combine constituent lots of the Cottage Court into a single lot. For all Cottage Courts approval shall require the recording against the property of covenants providing for permanent retention and maintenance of the common courtyard and the pedestrian passage, and restricting additions to and modifications of dwelling units or common structures and spaces which would not conform with the requirements of this Code for the Cottage Court Special Building Type. 
n.  All other standards for T4 Zones not explicitly described in this Section (5.4.13) shall apply to the Cottage Court Special Building Type. 
(Ord. No. 2558, § 1, 10-17-07) 
5.5 - SPECIFIC TO URBAN CENTER TRANSECT ZONES (T5) 
5.5.1  Building Disposition (T5) 
a.  Newly platted lots shall be dimensioned according to Section 5.5.11 
b.  Buildings shall be disposed in relation to the boundaries of their lots according to Section 5.5.11. 
c.  One principal building at the Frontage and one Outbuilding to the rear of the principal building may be built on each lot as shown in Table 16C. 
d.  Lot coverage by building shall not exceed that shown in Section 5.5.11. 
e.  Facades shall be built parallel to the Principal Frontage Line, and shall be built out along a minimum of 70% of the length of the Principal Frontage Line as measured at the actual Facade Setback. A Streetscreen shall be built co-planar with the Facade along the unbuilt length of the Principal Frontage Line in accordance with 5.5.5b. 
f.  Setbacks for Principal Buildings shall be as shown in Section 5.5.11 and on Table 14l. In the case of an Infill lot, front Setbacks shall match one or the other of the existing adjacent Setbacks, so long as the resulting Setback conforms with the requirements of Table 14l. Setbacks may otherwise be adjusted by Warrant. 
g.  Rear Setbacks for Outbuildings shall be a minimum of 12 feet measured from the centerline of the Alley or Rear Lane easement. In the absence of a Rear Alley or Lane, the rear Setback shall be as shown in Section 5.5.11. 
h.  Building Types shall be as shown in Table 9. 
i.  [RESERVED] 
j.  Buildings shall have their principal pedestrian entrances on a Frontage Line. 
5.5.2  Building Configuration (T5) 
a.  Private Frontage types shall conform to and be allocated in accordance with Table 7 and Section 5.5.11. 
b.  Awnings may encroach the public sidewalk without limit. Stoops may encroach 100% of the depth of a Setback. Open porches and awnings may encroach up to 50% of the depth of the Setback. Balconies and bay windows may encroach up to 25% of the depth of the Setback. 
c.  Loading docks and service areas shall be permitted on Frontages only by Warrant. 
d.  Building Heights shall conform to Table 8 and be as shown in Section 5.5.11. 
e.  A first level Residential or Lodging Function shall be raised a minimum of 2 feet from average sidewalk grade. 
f.  Building Height shall be measured from the Height Baseline appropriate to the site: outside Flood Hazard Areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the average grade at the primary Frontage Line for the lot; inside areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the Minimum Buildable Elevation. Any vertical offset of more than 4 feet between the Height Baseline and the finish surface of the first floor above the Height Baseline shall be counted as a complete Story in determining the height of the building. 
g.  No Story shall exceed 14 feet in height, measured from floor to ceiling. 
h.  Any Basement-level space required for compliance with Flood Ordinance requirements in excess of 8 feet and not contained within a filled foundation or chain-wall foundation shall be designed for use as (i) parking or storage space set into the structure into the second and deeper Layers, and concealed from view from all streets, (ii) an open market, loggia, porch, or combination thereof, or other open-air area for recreation, relaxation or gathering, (iii) enclosed commercial or retail space to the extent permitted by applicable FEMA requirements and T5 Zone usage limits, or other use permitted by the Planning Office. 
5.5.3  Building Function & Density (T5) 
a.  Buildings in each Transect Zone shall conform to the Functions described in Tables 10 and 11 and Section 5.5.11. Functions that do not conform to the requirements of Tables 10 or 11 shall require approval by Warrant or by Variance. 
b.  Function Volume accommodated on a lot shall be limited by the ability of Available Parking to meet the parking requirement corresponding to the Function Volume. However, under no circumstances may the Function Volume accommodated on the lot exceed the Density Allowance for that lot. 
c.  The parking requirement for any Function associated with a building may be reduced where on-site parking spaces required for two distinct Functions are physically and practicably accessible within the same facility to vehicles associated with the different uses. To compute the reduction in spaces required for each of the two Functions, divide the smaller of the parking requirements for the two Functions by the appropriate Sharing Factor from Table 12, then subtract the result from the smaller of the two parking requirements. This difference is one-half the Effective Parking Bonus, and the original parking requirement for each of the two Functions may be reduced by one-half the Effective Parking Bonus. Effective Parking Bonuses shall only be permitted for distinct Functions pair-wise. To qualify for any Effective Parking Bonus, the parking spaces included in the calculation for both Functions shall be on the usage site generating the requirements, publicly available, and mutually accessible. 
d.  Within the Long Pedestrian Shed of a TOD, the Effective Parking available for calculating the Function Volume permitted on each lot may be increased by twenty-five percent (25%), or conversely, the parking requirement for a particular Function Volume may be reduced by twenty percent (20%). 
e.  Accessory uses of Limited Lodging or Limited Office shall be permitted within an Outbuilding. 
f.  First Story Commercial shall be permitted throughout and shall be required at Mandatory Shopfront Frontages. 
g.  A Home Occupation operated by the property owner is permitted by right in any single Story or Outbuilding of a fee-simple lot, subject to the functional limitations stated in Article 7 (Definitions). Home Occupation requires no additional parking for a lot in a T5 Zone. 
h.  [RESERVED] 
i.  [RESERVED] 
j.  Adjusted Density is further modified and limited according to Section 5.5.12. 
k.  Manufacturing within the first Story may be permitted by Planning Commission Approval. 
5.5.4  Parking Standards (T5) 
a.  Vehicular parking shall be required as shown in Tables 11 and 12 in conjunction with Sections 5.1.9 and 5.5.3. 
b.  Publicly available on-street parking along the Frontage Lines of a lot shall be counted toward the parking requirement of the Retail Functions of the building on the lot, subject to the requirement that the lot owner provides and dedicates to the City parking meters and street tree plantings along the Frontage Lines according to the specifications of the Community Plan and the CRC. 
c.  Maximum parking ratios and maximum on-site parking ratios may be established by the CRC. 
d.  [RESERVED] 
e.  Bicycle rack space for a minimum of one (1) bicycle shall be provided within the Public or Private Frontage for every ten vehicular parking spaces. 
f.  All parking areas shall be located at the Third Lot Layer. 
g.  Parking shall be accessed by the Alley or Rear Lane when such are available on the Community Plan. 
h.  The vehicular entrance of a parking lot or garage on a Frontage shall be no wider than 30 feet. 
i.  View of parking lots and parking garages shall be masked from the Frontage by a Liner Building or other buildings or Streetscreen as specified in Section 5.5.5b. Parking requirements shall be waived for Functions in Liner Buildings of twenty-five (25) feet depth or less constructed to screen Public-Parking Facilities. 
j.  Reduction of impervious surfaces through the use of interlocking pavers, compacted oyster shell, or other pervious paving on a list of materials approved and maintained by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect shall be permitted by right for all surface parking lots in T5 Zones. 
k.  Primary pedestrian entrances to all surface parking lots and all Public-Parking Facilities shall be directly from a Frontage Line or from a Frontage Line by way of a Cross-Block Pedestrian Passage. All parking areas provided on-site shall have prominently marked, direct, easy pedestrian access to a Frontage street. Any direct entrance to a Principal Building from a Public-Parking Facility shall be via Unadvertised Secured Entry Door and shall not be publicly accessible. However, for buildings whose principal purpose is to provide Public Parking and which comprise a parking structure and Liner Building without additional Retail, Office, Lodging, or Residential floor space beyond that provided in the Liner Building, pedestrian access may require passage through the Liner Building. This provision shall not be adjusted or eliminated by Warrant. 
l.  For buildings on Secondary Grids (S-Grids), parking lots may be allowed on the Frontage by Warrant (see Section 5.8.1a). 
m.  Required parking may be provided within one-quarter mile of the site that it serves by Right. Required parking may be provided more than one-quarter mile from the site provided that transit is provided between the site and the remote parking area, subject to approval by Warrant. 
n.  All parking in T5 Zones shall be Unbundled if located within a City Center, RCD, or other designated Unbundled Parking Area appearing on the Community Plan. This requirement shall not be adjusted or eliminated by Warrant. 
o.  For T5 Zones within a City Center, RCD, or an Unbundled Parking Area, at least one-half the parking spaces required for a proposed building or renovation of an existing building shall be provided off-site in a Public-Parking Facility within one-quarter mile (1/4 mi), independent of the number of parking spaces provided on-site. The distance limit may be increased to one-half mile (1/2 mi) by Warrant, subject to provision m above. 
p.  For T5 Zones within a City Center, RCD, or an Unbundled Parking Area, all on-site parking spaces shall be provided as part of a Public-Parking Facility. The maximum number of parking spaces which may be provided on-site in a T5 Zone within a City Center, RCD, or an Unbundled Parking Area shall be 150% of the parking requirement for the site. 
q.  Parking requirements for the planned usage of a proposed building or renovation in a T5 Zone may be satisfied by payment to the City's Public-Parking Fund of In-Lieu Fees in accordance with the City's Parking Reform Ordinance, if one exists. 
5.5.5  Architectural Standards (T5) 
The following are general city-wide requirements, and may be modified or overruled by Community Architectural Guidelines adopted as part of the Official Community Plan: 
a.  Building wall materials may be combined on each Facade only horizontally, with the heavier below the lighter, relative weights being determined for approved materials by the Urban Design Center. 
b.  Streetscreens should be between 4 and 8 feet in height and constructed of a material matching the adjacent building Facade. The Streetscreen may be replaced by a hedge or fence approved by the City Architect or the Urban Design Center by Warrant. Streetscreens shall have openings no larger than necessary to allow automobile and pedestrian access. A single length of Streetscreen along a Frontage, including any pedestrian and vehicle openings, may be no longer than 70 feet maximum. 
c.  All openings, including porches, galleries, arcades and windows, with the exception of storefronts, shall be square or vertical in proportion, with width no greater than height. With the exception of storefronts, two adjacent openings in a Facade shall be separated by a distance not less than one-half the width of the smaller of the openings. 
d.  Openings above the first Story shall not exceed 50% of the total building wall area for each Facade, with each Facade being calculated independently. Openings in the Facade above the fourth Story shall include closeable panels, screens, or glass doors which shall remain closed when not in use. 
e.  The Facades on Retail Frontages shall be detailed as storefronts and glazed with clear glass no less than 70% of the sidewalk-level Story. 
f.  Doors and windows that operate as sliders are prohibited along Frontages. 
g.  No Unarticulated length of Facade at street level shall exceed twenty (20) feet. 
h.  Buildings may have flat roofs enclosed by parapets or sloped roofs. Pitched roofs shall be symmetrically sloped no less than 5:12, except that porches and attached sheds may be no less than 2:12. 
i.  Flat roofs shall be enclosed by parapets a minimum of 42 inches high, or higher as required to conceal mechanical equipment to the satisfaction of the CRC. 
j.  The exterior finish materials on all Facades shall be limited to stone, brick and stucco; or to such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
k.  Balconies, galleries and arcades shall be made of concrete, painted wood or metal, or shall be clad in painted solid PVC, urethane, or similar painted solid synthetic trim, or shall be constructed of or clad in such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. Above the fourth Story, balconies projecting more than twelve inches (12 in) from the Facade shall be counted in their full projection as the outer plane of that Facade for purposes meeting of setback, Stepback, and Buildout-at-Height requirements. Above the second Story no balcony projecting from a Facade shall not extend to a width greater than 50% of the width of that Facade. Above the fourth Story, a balcony's width shall not exceed 150% of the width of the Facade openings providing access to the balcony. 
l.  Streetscreens shall be located coplanar with the building Facade line as shown in Table 16D. 
m.  Subject to the other requirements of this Code, including without limitation Article 5, any building designed in a manner consistent with the publication entitled "A Pattern Book for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods" shall be permitted as of right on certification of such by the Urban Design Center or City Architect. 
n.  Within any Historic District established or recognized by the Mayor and City Council, or with respect to any Historic Structure or Historic Site so established or recognized, each building and structure, and its improvement, alteration, addition, or reconstruction, shall comply with the Historical Architectural Guidelines of the City's Historical Commission, if one has been established by an Ordinance approved by the Mayor and City Council, and shall be subject to approval by the City Architect and the Historical Commission. 
o.  Within any Community Planning Area subject to Community Plans which require Architectural Review in some or all districts, buildings other than single-family residences and their associated ancillary buildings shall be subject to approval of the City Architect in accordance with the City's Architectural Review Ordinance if such exists. 
p.  [RESERVED] 
5.5.6  Environmental Standards (T5) 
a.  Transect Zones manifest a range of responses to natural and urban conditions. In case of conflict, to the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, the natural infrastructure shall have priority in the more rural zones (T1-T3) and the urban infrastructure shall have priority in the more urban zones (T4-T6) as detailed in Sections 5.2 through 5.6. 
b.  The landscape installed shall consist primarily of durable native species tolerant of soil compaction. 
c.  Impermeable surface by building shall be confined to the ratio of lot coverage as shown in Table 14H. 
d.  To the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, city ordinance, or overlay district requirements, management of storm water shall be primarily off-site through underground storm drainage, and there shall be no retention or detention required on the individual lot. 
e.  Within T5 Zones, building roofs shall be constructed as Cool Roofs where this requirement does not conflict with architectural standards, guidelines, and requirements of this Code or the Community Plan. 
5.5.7  Landscape Standards (T5) 
a.  Trees shall not be required in the First Layer (Table 16D). 
b.  [RESERVED]. 
c.  The First Layer as shown in Table 16D shall be landscaped or paved to match the Enfronting Public Frontage as shown in Table 4. 
d.  Trees shall be a species with shade canopies that, at maturity, attain a height beyond the tops of the second Stories of buildings, and which do not visually obstruct the first Story; however, quick-growth trees used for short-term shade production and designated on the Community Plan to be replaced with more long-lived species on a specified schedule shall be permitted without restrictions to shade canopy height. 
e.  Trees and shrubs on a list of invasive, problematic, or undesirable species maintained by the Urban Design Center shall not be used in any Landscaping of any kind in Zone T5. 
5.5.8  Signage Standards (T5) 
a.  All provisions of the City's separate Comprehensive Sign Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, according to the City of Gulfport's Code of Ordinances, Article IV. Signs, Chapter 9 Planning and Development, section 9-91, Signs in B-1, B-2, B-4, I-1, I-2, I-3 districts. 
(Ord. No. 2627, § 4, 4-21-09) 
5.5.9  Ambient Standards (T5) 
a.  Sound levels measured at the building Frontage shall not exceed 70 decibels from sunrise to midnight and 60 decibels from midnight to sunrise. All provisions of the City of Gulfport Noise Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, and where in conflict herewith, the stricter provision shall apply. 
b.  Permanent outdoor Luminaires other than those which are Fully Shielded shall be so equipped as not to exceed a total lamp power of 40 Watts per Luminaire for Incandescent Lamps, or of 10 Watts per Luminaire for non-Incandescent Lamps. 
c.  The mounting height of a permanent outdoor Luminaire which is attached directly to the Facade or Elevation of a building shall not exceed 12 feet, where mounting height is measured from the topmost point of the Luminaire. For a permanent outdoor Luminaire supported by any other means, mounting height shall be limited to the lesser of one-third the distance from the Luminaire to any property line or 32.5 feet, adjustable by Warrant. 
d.  Streetlights shall be Fully Shielded or Nearly Fully Shielded and of a general type illustrated in Table 5. 
e.  Outdoor storage shall be screened from view from any Frontage by a Streetscreen in conformance with Section 5.5.5b. 
5.5.10  [RESERVED] 
  
5.5.12  Building-Scale Density Limits, Transfers, and Bonuses (T5) 
a.  [RESERVED] 
b.  Lots within T5 Zones shall be eligible for inclusion in both Density Transfer Receiving Areas and Density Bonus Receiving Areas as designated on the Community Plan. 
c.  Lots in T5 Zones may be designated on the Community Plan as Density Sending Areas. Such a lot carries Density Rights equal to the By-Right Density Allowance for the lot. The Density Transfer transaction shall be handled in accordance with Section 1.7.3. 
5.6 - SPECIFIC TO URBAN CORE TRANSECT ZONES (T6) 
5.6.1  Building Disposition (T6) 
a.  Newly platted lots shall be dimensioned according to Section 5.6.11. 
b.  Buildings shall be disposed in relation to the boundaries of their lots according to Section 5.6.11. 
c.  One Principal Building at the Frontage may be built on each lot as shown in Table 16C. 
d.  Lot coverage by building shall not exceed that shown in Section 5.6.11. 
e.  Facades shall be built parallel to the Principal Frontage Line, and shall be built out along a minimum of 80% of the length of the Principal Frontage Line as measured at the actual Facade Setback. A Streetscreen shall be built co-planar with the Facade along the unbuilt length of the Principal Frontage Line in accordance with 5.6.5b. 
f.  Setbacks for Principal Buildings shall be as shown in Table 141. In the case of an Infill lot, Setbacks shall match one or the other of the existing adjacent front Setbacks, so long as the resulting Setback conforms with the requirements of Table 141. Setbacks may otherwise be adjusted by Warrant. 
g.  Rear Setbacks shall be a minimum of 12 feet measured from the centerline of the Alley or Rear Lane easement. In the absence of Rear Alley or Lane, the rear Setback shall be as shown in Section 5.6.11. 
h.  Building Types shall be as shown in Table 9. 
i.  [RESERVED] 
j.  Buildings shall have their principal pedestrian entrances on a Frontage Line. 
5.6.2  Building Configuration (T6) 
a.  Private Frontage types shall conform to and be allocated in accordance with Table 7 and Section 5.6.11. 
b.  Awnings may encroach the public sidewalk without limit. Stoops may encroach 100% of the depth of a Setback. Open porches and awnings may encroach up to 50% of the depth of the Setback. Balconies and bay windows may encroach up to 25% of the depth of the Setback. 
c.  Loading docks and service areas shall be permitted on Frontages only by Warrant. 
d.  Building Heights shall conform to Table 8 and be as shown in Section 5.6.11. 
e.  A first level Residential Function or Lodging Function shall be raised a minimum of 2 feet from average sidewalk grade. 
f.  Building Height shall be measured from the Height Baseline appropriate to the site: outside Flood Hazard Areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the average grade at the primary Frontage Line for the lot; inside areas regulated by the City's Flood Damage Prevention Ordinance, the Height Baseline shall be the Minimum Buildable Elevation. Any vertical offset of more than 4 feet between the Height Baseline itself and the finish surface of the first floor above the Height Baseline shall be counted as a complete Story in determining the height of the building. 
g.  Stories other than the first shall not exceed 14 feet in height, measured from floor to ceiling. The first story above the Height Baseline shall not exceed 20 feet in height, measured from floor to ceiling. 
h.  Any Basement-level space required for compliance with Flood Ordinance requirements in excess of 8 feet and not contained within a filled foundation or chain-wall foundation shall be designed for use as (i) parking or storage space set into the structure into the second and deeper Layers, and concealed from view from all streets, (ii) an open market, loggia, porch, or combination thereof, or other open-air area for recreation, relaxation or gathering, (iii) enclosed commercial or retail space to the extent permitted by applicable FEMA requirements and T6 Zone usage limits, or other use permitted by the Planning Office. 
5.6.3  Building Function & Density (T6) 
a.  Buildings in each Transect Zone shall conform to the Functions described in Tables 10 and 11 and Section 5.6.11. Functions that do not conform to the requirements of Tables 10 and 11 shall require approval by Warrant or by Variance. 
b.  Function Volume accommodated on a lot shall be limited by the ability of Available Parking to meet the parking requirement corresponding to the Function Volume. However, under no circumstances may the Function Volume accommodated on the lot exceed the Density Allowance for that lot. 
c.  The parking requirement for any Function associated with a building may be reduced where on-site parking spaces required for two distinct Functions are physically and practicably accessible within the same facility to vehicles associated with the different uses. To compute the reduction in spaces required for each of the two Functions, divide the smaller of the parking requirements for the two Functions by the appropriate Sharing Factor from Table 12, then subtract the result from the smaller of the two parking requirements. This difference is one-half the Effective Parking Bonus, and the original parking requirement for each of the two Functions may be reduced by one-half the Effective Parking Bonus. Effective Parking Bonuses shall only be permitted for distinct Functions pairwise. To qualify for any Effective Parking Bonus, the parking spaces included in the calculation for both Functions shall be on the usage site generating the requirements, publicly available, and mutually accessible. 
d.  Within the Long Pedestrian Shed of a TOD, the Effective Parking available for calculating the Function Volume permitted on each lot may be increased by twenty-five percent (25%), or conversely, the parking requirement for a particular Function Volume may be reduced by twenty percent (20%). 
e.  [RESERVED]. 
f.  Commercial Functions shall be permitted on first Stories throughout and shall be required at Mandatory Shopfront Frontages. 
g.  A Home Occupation operated by the property owner is permitted by right in any single Story of a fee-simple lot, subject to the functional limitations stated in Article 7 (Definitions). Home Occupation requires no additional parking for a lot in a T6 Zone. 
h.  [RESERVED] 
i.  [RESERVED] 
j.  Adjusted Density is further modified and limited according to Section 5.6.12. 
k.  Manufacturing within the first Story may be permitted by Planning Commission Approval. 
5.6.4  Parking Standards (T6) 
a.  Vehicular parking shall be required as shown in Tables 11 and 12 in conjunction with Sections 5.1.9 and 5.6.3. 
b.  Publicly available on-street parking along the Frontage Lines of a lot shall be counted toward the Retail Function parking requirement of the building on the lot, subject to the requirement that the lot owner provides and dedicates to the City parking meters and street tree planting along the Frontage Lines according to the specifications of the Community Plan and the CRC. 
c.  [RESERVED] 
d.  Parking requirements for Retail usage shall be waived for Retail areas under 1,000 square feet. 
e.  Bicycle rack space for a minimum of one (1) bicycle shall be provided within the Public or Private Frontage for every seven (7) vehicular parking spaces. 
f.  All parking areas shall be located at the Third Lot Layer. 
g.  Parking shall be accessed by the Alley or Rear Lane when such are available on the Community Plan. 
h.  The vehicular entrance of a parking lot or garage on a Frontage shall be no wider than 30 feet. 
i.  View of parking lots and parking garages shall be masked from the Frontage by a Liner Building or other buildings or by a Streetscreen as specified in Section 5.6.5b. Parking requirements shall be waived for Functions in Liner Buildings of twenty-five (25) feet depth or less constructed to screen Public-Parking Facilities. 
j.  Reduction of impervious surfaces through the use of interlocking pavers, compacted oyster shell, or other pervious paving on a list of materials approved and maintained by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect shall be permitted by right for all surface parking lots in T6 Zones. 
k.  Primary pedestrian entrances to all surface parking lots and all Public-Parking Facilities shall be directly from a Frontage Line or from a Frontage Line by way of a Cross-Block Pedestrian Passage. All parking areas provided on-site shall have prominently marked, direct, easy pedestrian access to a Frontage street. Any direct entrance to a Principal Building from a Public-Parking Facility shall be via Unadvertised Secured Entry Door and shall not be publicly accessible. However, for buildings whose principal purpose is to provide Public Parking and which comprise a parking structure and Liner Building without additional Retail, Office, Lodging, or Residential floor space beyond that provided in the Liner Building, pedestrian access may require passage through the Liner Building. This provision shall not be adjusted or eliminated by Warrant. 
l.  For buildings on Secondary Grids (S-Grids), parking lots may be allowed on the Frontage by Warrant (see Section 5.8.1a). 
m.  Required parking may be provided within one-quarter mile of the site that it serves by right. Required parking may be provided more than one-quarter mile from the site provided that transit is provided between the site and the remote parking area, subject to approval by Warrant. 
n.  All parking in T6 Zones shall be Unbundled. This requirement shall not be adjusted or eliminated by Warrant. 
o.  At least one-half the parking spaces required for a proposed building or renovation of an existing building shall be provided off-site in a Public-Parking Facility within one-quarter mile (1/4 mi) of the site, independent of the number of parking spaces provided on-site. This requirement shall not be reduced or eliminated by Warrant. The distance limit may be increased to one-half mile (1/2 mi) by Warrant subject to provision m above. 
p.  Within T6 Zones, all on-site parking spaces shall be provided as part of a Public-Parking Facility. The maximum number of parking spaces which may be provided on-site in a T6 Zone shall be 150% of the parking requirement for the site. 
q.  Parking requirements for the planned usage of a proposed building or renovation in a T6 Zone may be satisfied by payment to the City's Public-Parking Fund of In-Lieu Fees in accordance with the City's Parking Reform Ordinance, if one exists. 
5.6.5  Architectural Standards (T6) 
The following are general city-wide requirements, and may be modified or overruled by Community Architectural Guidelines adopted as part of the Official Community Plan: 
a.  Building wall materials may be combined on each Facade only horizontally, with the heavier below the lighter, relative weights being determined for approved materials by the Urban Design Center. 
b.  Streetscreens should be between 3.5 and 8 feet in height and constructed of a material matching the adjacent building Facade. The Streetscreen may be replaced by a hedge or fence by Warrant. Streetscreens shall have openings no larger than necessary to allow automobile and pedestrian access. A single length of Streetscreen along a Frontage, including any pedestrian and vehicle openings, may be no longer than 70 feet maximum. 
c.  All openings, including porches, galleries, arcades and windows, with the exception of storefronts, shall be square or vertical in proportion, with width no greater than height. With the exception of storefronts, two adjacent openings in a Facade shall be separated by a distance not less than one-half the width of the smaller of the openings. 
d.  For each Facade, openings above the first Story shall not exceed 50% of the total building wall area, with each Facade being calculated independently. Openings in the Facade above the fourth Story shall include closeable panels, screens, or glass doors which shall remain closed when not in use. 
e.  The Facades on Retail Frontages shall be detailed as storefronts and glazed with clear glass no less than 70% of the sidewalk-level story. 
f.  Doors and windows that operate as sliders are prohibited along Frontages. 
g.  No Unarticulated length of Facade at street level shall exceed twenty (20) feet. 
h.  Buildings may have flat roofs enclosed by parapets, or sloped roofs. Pitched roofs shall be symmetrically sloped no less than 5:12, except that porches and attached sheds may be no less than 2:15. 
i.  Flat roofs shall be enclosed by parapets a minimum of 42 inches high, or higher as required to conceal mechanical equipment to the satisfaction of the CRC. 
j.  The exterior finish materials on all Facades shall be limited to stone, brick and stucco; or to such other materials as shall appear on a list maintained and approved by the Urban Design Center and the City Architect. 
k.  Balconies, galleries and arcades shall be made of concrete, painted wood or metal. Above the fourth Story, balconies projecting more than twelve inches (12 in) from the Facade shall be counted in their full projection as the outer plane of that Facade for purposes meeting of setback, Stepback, and Buildout-at-Height requirements. Above the fourth Story, a balcony's width shall not exceed 150% of the width of the Facade openings providing access to the balcony. 
l.  Streetscreens shall be located coplanar with the building Facade line as shown in Table 16D. 
m.  Subject to the other requirements of this Code, including without limitation Article 5, any building designed in a manner consistent with the publication entitled "A Pattern Book for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods" shall be permitted as of right on certification of such by the Urban Design Center or City Architect. 
n.  Within any Historic District established or recognized by the Mayor and City Council, or with respect to any Historic Structure or Historic Site so established or recognized, each building and structure, and its improvement, alteration, addition, or reconstruction, shall comply with the Historical Architectural Guidelines of the City's Historical Commission, if one has been established by an Ordinance approved by the Mayor and City Council, and shall be subject to approval by the City Architect and the Historic Commission. 
o.  Within any Community Planning Area subject to Community Plans which require Architectural Review in some or all districts, buildings other than single-family residences and their associated ancillary buildings shall be subject to approval of the City Architect in accordance with the City's Architectural Review Ordinance if such exists. 
p.  [Reserved] 
5.6.6  Environmental Standards (T6) 
a.  Transect Zones manifest a range of responses to natural and urban conditions. In case of conflict, to the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, the natural infrastructure shall have priority in the more rural zones (T1-T3) and the urban infrastructure shall have priority in the more urban zones (T4-T6) as detailed in Sections 5.2 through 5.6. 
b.  The species of landscape installed shall consist primarily of durable native species tolerant of soil compaction. 
c.  Impermeable surface by building shall be confined to the ratio of lot coverage by building as shown in Table 14H. 
d.  To the extent not inconsistent with applicable state or federal law, city ordinance, or overlay district requirements, management of storm water shall be primarily off-site through underground storm drainage and there shall be no retention or detention required on the individual lot. 
e.  Within T6 Zones, building roofs shall be constructed as Cool Roofs where this requirement does not conflict with architectural standards, guidelines, and requirements of this Code or the Community Plan.

a.  Trees shall not be required in the First Layer (Table 16D).

Trees shall be a species with shade canopies that, at maturity, attain a height beyond the tops of the second Stories of buildings, and which do not visually obstruct the first Stories; however, quick-growth trees used for short-term shade production and designated on the Community Plan to be replaced with more long-lived species on a specified schedule shall be permitted without restrictions to shade canopy height. 
e.  Trees and shrubs on a list of invasive, problematic, or undesirable species maintained by the Urban Design Center shall not be used in any Landscaping of any kind in Zone T6. 
5.6.8  Signage Standards (T6)

(Ord. No. 2627, § 5, 4-21-09) 
5.6.9  Ambient Standards (T6) 
a.  Sound levels measured at the building Frontage shall not exceed 70 decibels from sunrise to midnight and 60 decibels from midnight to sunrise. All provisions of the City of Gulfport Noise Ordinance shall continue to be applicable, and where in conflict herewith, the stricter provision shall apply. 
b.  Permanent outdoor Luminaires other than those which are Fully Shielded or Nearly Fully Shielded shall be so equipped as not to exceed a total lamp power of 40 Watts per Luminaire for Incandescent Lamps, or of 10 Watts per Luminaire for non-Incandescent Lamps. 
c.  The mounting height of a permanent outdoor Luminaire which is attached directly to the Facade or Elevation of a building shall not exceed 12 feet, where mounting height is measured from the top-most point of the Luminaire. For a permanent outdoor Luminaire supported by any other means, mounting height shall be limited to the lesser of one-third the distance from the Luminaire to any property line or 37.5 feet, adjustable by Warrant. 
d.  Streetlights shall be Fully Shielded or Nearly Fully Shielded and of a general type illustrated in Table 5. 
e.  Outdoor storage shall be screened from view from any Frontage by a Streetscreen in conformance with Section 5.6.5b.

a.  [RESERVED] 
b.  Lots within T6 Zones shall be eligible for inclusion in both Density Transfer Receiving Areas and Density Bonus Receiving Areas as designated on the Community Plan. 
c.  Lots in T6 Zones may be designated on the Community Plan as Density Sending Areas. Such a lot carries Density Rights equal to the By-Right Density Allowance for the lot. The Density Transfer transaction shall be handled in accordance with Section 1.7.3. 
5.7 - CIVIC FUNCTIONS 
5.7.1  General 
a.  Community Plans shall designate, or allow by Planning Commission approval or by Warrant according to the requirements of Table 10, Civic Space (CS) and Civic Buildings (CB). 
b.  Civic Functions may be Warranted so long as they do not occupy more than a total of 20% of the area of each Pedestrian Shed, including associated parking areas. A Civic Function requiring more than 20% of the Pedestrian Shed shall become its own Special District, with provisions written as necessary. (See Table 15.) 
c.  Parking for Civic Functions shall be determined by Warrant. 
5.7.2  Civic Space (CS) 
a.  Civic Spaces may be approved by Warrant in any Transect Zone. 
b.  Civic Spaces shall be generally designed as described in Table 13. 
5.7.3  Civic Building (CB)
